translated: What is this, that the lifespan of Shakyamuni Buddha is so short, namely eighty years?

original: atha khalu te buddhā bhagavantaḥ smṛtāḥ saṃprajānāstaṃ ruciraketuṃ bodhisattvametadavocan /
analyzed: atha khalu te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ smṛtāḥ saṃprajānāḥ tam ruciraketum bodhisattvam etat avocan
translated: Then those Buddha Bhagavans, being mindful and fully aware, said this to that Bodhisattva Ruciraketu:

original: mā tvaṃ kulaputraivaṃ cintaya evaṃ parīttaṃ bhagavataḥ śākyamunerāyuḥpramāṇam /
analyzed: mā tvam kula putra evam cintaya evam parīttam bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ āyuḥ pramāṇam
translated: Do not think thus, O son of noble family, that the lifespan of Shakyamuni Buddha is so short.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: na ca vai kulaputra taṃ samanupaśyāmaḥ sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ sadevamānuṣāsurāyāṃ yaḥ samarthaḥ syādbhagavataḥ śākyamunestathāgatasyāyuḥpramāṇaparyantamadhigantuṃ yāvadaparāntakoṭibhiḥ sthāpayitvā tathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksambuddhaiḥ /
analyzed: na ca vai kula putra tam samanupaśyāmaḥ sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyām prajāyām sa deva mānuṣa asurāyām yaḥ samarthaḥ syāt bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya āyuḥ pramāṇa paryantam adhigantum yāvat aparānta koṭibhiḥ sthāpayitvā tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksambuddhaiḥ
translated: Noble sir, we do not see anyone in the world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods, humans, and asuras, who is able to fathom the extent of the lifespan of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, except for the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

analyzed: samanantara udāhṛte taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ tathāgata āyuḥ pramāṇa nirdeśe
translated: Immediately after those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, had spoken this teaching on the lifespan of the Tathāgatas,

original: atha tāvadbuddhānubhāvena kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāśca devaputrāḥ saṃnipatitā yāvannāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragā anekāni ca bodhisattvakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi tasmin ruciraketubodhisattvasya gṛhe samāgatā āsan /
analyzed: atha tāvat buddha anubhāvena kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ saṃnipatitāḥ yāvat nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ anekāni ca bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi tasmin ruciraketu bodhisattvasya gṛhe samāgatāḥ āsan
translated: then, by the power of the Buddhas, the gods of the desire realm and form realm assembled, as well as nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, and many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas assembled in the house of the bodhisattva Ruciraketu.

original: atha te tathāgatāḥ sarvaparṣado bhagavataḥ śākyamunerāyuḥpramāṇanirdeśaṃ gāthābhirabhyabhāṣan /
analyzed: atha te tathāgatāḥ sarva parṣadaḥ bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ āyuḥ pramāṇa nirdeśam gāthābhiḥ abhyabhāṣan
translated: Then those Tathāgatas spoke these verses to the entire assembly, teaching the extent of the lifespan of the Blessed One, the Śākyamuni Tathāgata:

analyzed: jala arṇaveṣu sarveṣu śakyante bindubhiḥ gaṇayitum
translated: In all the oceans of water, it is possible to count the drops.

original: na tu śākyamunerāyuḥ śakyaṃ gaṇayituṃ kvacit // //
analyzed: na tu śākyamuneḥ āyuḥ śakyam gaṇayitum kvacid
translated: But the lifespan of Shakyamuni cannot be counted anywhere.

original: sumeruṃ paramāṇavaḥ kṛtvā śakyaṃ ca saṃkhyayā /
analyzed: sumerum paramāṇavaḥ kṛtvā śakyam ca saṃkhyayā
translated: Even if Sumeru were made into atoms, it would be possible to count them.

original: na tu śākyamunerāyuḥ śakyaṃ gaṇayituṃ kvacit // //
analyzed: na tu śākyamuneḥ āyuḥ śakyam gaṇayitum kvacid
translated: But the lifespan of Shakyamuni cannot be counted anywhere.

original: yāḥ kāścit pṛthivīḥ santi yāvantaḥ paramāṇavaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ kāścid pṛthivīḥ santi yāvantaḥ paramāṇavaḥ
translated: Whatever earths there are, as many atoms as there are,

original: śakyaṃ gaṇayituṃ sarvā na tu cāyurjinasya vai // //
analyzed: śakyam gaṇayitum sarvāḥ na tu ca āyuḥ jinasya vai
translated: it is possible to count all of them, but not the lifespan of the Victorious One.

analyzed: ākāśam yadi vā kaścid icchet pramitum kenacid
translated: If someone wishes to measure space with something,

original: na tu śākyamunerāyuḥ śakyaṃ gaṇayituṃ kvacit // //
analyzed: na tu śākyamuneḥ āyuḥ śakyam gaṇayitum kvacid
translated: but the lifespan of Shakyamuni cannot be counted anywhere.

analyzed: iti uktāni ca kalpāni kalpa koṭi śatāni ca
translated: Thus, the eons that have been spoken of, and the hundreds of millions of eons,

original: eṣa tiṣṭhecca saṃbuddhaḥ saṃkhyāto na hi labhyate // //
analyzed: eṣa tiṣṭhet ca saṃbuddhaḥ saṃkhyātaḥ na hi labhyate
translated: this fully enlightened one would remain, but cannot be found by counting.

original: yasmād dve kāraṇe tasya tathaiva dvau ca pratyayau /
analyzed: yasmāt dve kāraṇe tasya tathā eva dvau ca pratyayau
translated: Because he has two causes, and likewise two conditions,

original: virataḥ parahiṃsāyā bahu dattaṃ ca bhojanam // //
analyzed: virataḥ para hiṃsāyāḥ bahu dattam ca bhojanam
translated: abstaining from harming others and giving much food.

analyzed: yasmāt tasya mahātmasya hi āyuḥ saṃkhyā na labhyate
translated: Because the lifespan of that great being cannot be found,

original: ityuktāni ca kalpāni saṃkhyāyāṃ na tathaiva ca // //
analyzed: iti uktāni ca kalpāni saṃkhyāyām na tathā eva ca
translated: thus, the eons that have been spoken of, and likewise in the counting,

original: tasmānna saṃśayo bho hi mā kiñcit kuru saṃśayam /
analyzed: tasmāt na saṃśayaḥ bho hi mā kiñcid kuru saṃśayam
translated: Therefore, do not have any doubt, do not entertain any doubt about anything.

analyzed: na jinasya āyuḥ paryantam kācid saṃkhyā upalabhyate
translated: The lifespan of the Victorious One is not perceived to have any limit.

original: atha khalu tasminsamaye tatra parṣadyācāryavyākaraṇaprāptaḥ kauṇḍinyo nāma brāhmaṇo'nekairbrāhmaṇasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ bhagavataḥ pūjākarma kṛtvā tathāgatasya mahāparinirvāṇaśabdaṃ śrutvā sahasotthāya bhagavataścaraṇayornipatya bhagavantamevamāha /
analyzed: atha khalu tasmin samaye tatra parṣadi ācārya vyākaraṇa prāptaḥ kauṇḍinyaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ ūnekaiḥ brāhmaṇa sahasraiḥ sārdham bhagavataḥ pūjā karma kṛtvā tathāgatasya mahā parinirvāṇa śabdam śrutvā sahasā utthāya bhagavataḥ caraṇayoḥ nipatya bhagavantam evam āha
translated: Then at that time, in that assembly, there was a brahmin named Kauṇḍinya who had attained the status of a teacher. Together with many thousands of brahmins, he performed acts of worship to the Blessed One. Having heard the news of the Tathāgata's great parinirvāṇa, he suddenly rose up and, bowing at the feet of the Blessed One, said this to the Blessed One:

original: sacetkila bhagavansarvasattvānukampako mahākāruṇiko hitaiṣī sarvasattvānāṃ mātāpitṛbhūto'samasamabhūtaścandrabhūta ālokakaro mahāprajñājñānasūryasamudgataḥ
analyzed: saced kila bhagavan sarva sattva anukampakaḥ mahā kāruṇikaḥ hita eṣī sarva sattvānām mātā pitṛ bhūta usama sama bhūtaḥ candra bhūtaḥ āloka karaḥ mahā prajñā jñāna sūrya samudgataḥ
translated: If, Blessed One, you are indeed compassionate towards all beings, greatly compassionate, wishing for the benefit of all beings, like a mother and father to all, unequaled, like the moon, a bringer of light, arisen as the sun of great wisdom and knowledge,

original: yadi tvaṃ sarvasattvān rāhulaṃ svaṃ saṃpaśyasi mahyamekaṃ varaṃ dehi /
analyzed: yadi tvam sarva sattvān rāhulam svam saṃpaśyasi mahyam ekam varam dehi
translated: if you see all beings as your own son Rāhula, then grant me one boon.

analyzed: bhagavān tūṣṇīmbhūtaḥ abhūt
translated: The Blessed One remained silent.

original: atha buddhānubhāvena tasyāṃ parṣadi sarvasattvapriyadarśano nāma litsavikumāraḥ /
analyzed: atha buddha anubhāvena tasyām parṣadi sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ nāma litsavi kumāraḥ
translated: Then, through the Buddha's power, in that assembly there was a young Licchavi named Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana.

analyzed: tasya pratibhānam utpannam
translated: He had this thought:

analyzed: saḥ ācārya vyākaraṇa prāptam kauṇḍinyam brāhmaṇam evam āha
translated: He said to the Brahmin Kaundinya, who had attained the teacher's approval:

original: kiṃ nu tvaṃ mahābrāhmaṇa bhagavantamekaṃ varaṃ yācase /
analyzed: kim nu tvam mahā brāhmaṇa bhagavantam ekam varam yācase
translated: Great Brahmin, are you asking the Blessed One for only one boon?

analyzed: aham te varam dadāmi
translated: I will give you a boon.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ āha
translated: The Brahmin said:

original: ahamasmillitsavikumāra bhagavataḥ pūjopasthānāya bhagavataḥ sarṣapaphalamātraṃ dhātumicchāmi nikṣepituṃ cūrṇaṃ dhātumabhiprayojanāyainaṃ sarṣapaphalamātraṃ dhātumabhipūjayitvā tridaśādhipatyaṃ labhyata ityevaṃ śrūūyate /
analyzed: aham asmin litsavi kumāra bhagavataḥ pūjā upasthānāya bhagavataḥ sarṣapa phala mātram dhātum icchāmi nikṣepitum cūrṇam dhātum abhiprayojanāya enam sarṣapa phala mātram dhātum abhipūjayitvā tridaśa ādhipatyam labhyate iti evam śrūūyate
translated: I, Litsavikumar, wish to offer to the Blessed One a relic the size of a mustard seed for worship, and to place a relic the size of a mustard seed for the purpose of making a relic stupa. It is said that by worshipping this relic the size of a mustard seed, one attains lordship over the thirty-three gods.

original: śṛṇu tvaṃ litsavikumāra suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtraṃ durvijñeyaṃ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ tādṛśairlakṣaṇaguṇaiḥ samanvāgataṃ kila suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtraṃ bhāvayiṣyati /
analyzed: śṛṇu tvam litsavi kumāra suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtram durvijñeyam sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām tādṛśaiḥ lakṣaṇa guṇaiḥ samanvāgatam kila suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtram bhāvayiṣyati
translated: Listen, Litsavikumar, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa-uttama Sūtra is difficult to understand for all Śrāvakas and Pratyekabuddhas. It is said that one who possesses such characteristics and qualities will contemplate the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa-uttama Sūtra.

original: evaṃ bho litsavikumāra durvijñeyaṃ duranubodhaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtram /
analyzed: evam bho litsavi kumāra durvijñeyam duranubodham suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtram
translated: So it is, Litsavikumar, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa-uttama Sūtra is difficult to understand and difficult to realize.

original: asmākameva pratyantadvīpikānāṃ brāhmaṇānāṃ sarṣapaphalamātraṃ dhātuṃ karaṇḍake nikṣipya dhāraṇamucitam /
analyzed: asmākam eva pratyanta dvīpikānām brāhmaṇānām sarṣapa phala mātram dhātum karaṇḍake nikṣipya dhāraṇam ucitam
translated: It is fitting for us, the Brahmins of the border islands, to place a relic the size of a mustard seed in a casket and carry it.

original: ahaṃ te varaṃ yāce yena sattvāḥ kṣiprameva tridaśādhipatyaṃ pratilambhino bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: aham te varam yāce yena sattvāḥ kṣipram eva tridaśa ādhipatyam pratilambhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: I ask for a boon by which beings will quickly attain lordship over the thirty-three gods.

original: tvaṃ kila bho litsavikumāra sarṣapaphalamātraṃ dhātuṃ tathāgatasya yācitum /
analyzed: tvam kila bho litsavi kumāra sarṣapa phala mātram dhātum tathāgatasya yācitum
translated: You, young Licchavi, are said to ask for a relic the size of a mustard seed of the Tathagata.

original: dhātuṃ ratnakaraṇḍake nikṣipya dhāraṇāt sarvasattvānāṃ tridaśādhipatyeśvaralābha itīcchase /
analyzed: dhātum ratna karaṇḍake nikṣipya dhāraṇāt sarva sattvānām tridaśa ādhipatya īśvara lābhaḥ iti icchase
translated: By placing the relic in a jeweled casket and carrying it, you wish for all beings to attain lordship over the thirty-three gods.

original: evaṃ mayā ca litsavikumāra iṣṭaṃ varam /
analyzed: evam mayā ca litsavi kumāraḥ iṣṭam varam
translated: Thus, young Licchavi, I have chosen the boon.

original: atha sarvasattvapriyadarśano nāma litsavikumāra ācāryavyākaraṇaprāptaṃ kauṇḍinyabrāhmaṇaṃ gāthābhirabhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha sarvasattva priyadarśanaḥ nāma litsavi kumāraḥ ācārya vyākaraṇa prāptam kauṇḍinya brāhmaṇam gāthābhiḥ abhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the young Licchavi named Sarvasattvapriyadarśana addressed the teacher and expounder Kauṇḍinya the Brahmin in verse:

original: yadā strotaḥsu gaṅgāyā roheyuḥ kumudāni ca /🔽raktāḥ kākā bhaviṣyanti śaṅkhavarṇāśca kokilāḥ // //
analyzed: yadā strotaḥsu gaṅgāyāḥ roheyuḥ kumudāni ca  raktāḥ kākāḥ bhaviṣyanti śaṅkha varṇāḥ ca kokilāḥ
translated: When white lotuses would grow in the streams of the Ganges,🔽and crows would become red and cuckoos white,

analyzed: jambuḥ tāla phalam dadyāt kharjūraḥ ca āmra mañjarīm
translated: the rose-apple tree would give the fruit of the palm tree, and the date tree a cluster of mango blossoms,🔽and the sun would rise in the west and set in the east,🔽then, Brahmin, I would give you the relic the size of a mustard seed.

analyzed: tadā sarṣapa mātram ca vyaktam dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Then the mineral will be clearly like a mustard seed.

analyzed: yadā kacchapa lomānām prāvāraiḥ suvṛtaḥ bhavet
translated: When one is well covered with blankets made of tortoise hair,

analyzed: hemante tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: removing the cold in winter, then the mineral will be.

analyzed: yadā maśaka pādānām aṭṭaka ālambanam bhavet
translated: When the support of the mosquito's legs becomes

analyzed: dṛḍham ca api aprakampi ca tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: firm and unshakable, then the mineral will be.

original: yadā tīkṣṇā mahāntaśca dantā jāyanti pāṇḍurāḥ /
analyzed: yadā tīkṣṇāḥ mahāntaḥ ca dantāḥ jāyanti pāṇḍurāḥ
translated: When sharp, large, and white teeth grow

analyzed: jalaukānām hi sarveṣām tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: for all leeches, then the mineral will be.

analyzed: yadā śaśa viṣāṇena niḥśreṇī su dṛḍhā bhavet
translated: When a firm and unshakable ladder is made

analyzed: svargasya ārohaṇa arthāya tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: with the horn of a rabbit for ascending to heaven, then the mineral will be.

original: tāṃ niśreṇīṃ yadāruhya candraṃ bhakṣati mūṣikaḥ /
analyzed: tām niśreṇīm yadā āruhya candram bhakṣati mūṣikaḥ
translated: When a mouse, having climbed that ladder, eats the moon

analyzed: rāhum ca paridhāveta tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: and chases Rahu, then the mineral will be.

analyzed: yadā madya ghaṭam pītvā makṣikāḥ grāma cāriṇyaḥ
translated: When village-roaming flies, having drunk a pot of liquor,

analyzed: agāre vāsam kalpeyuḥ tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati  /
translated: make their dwelling in a house, then the mineral will be.

analyzed: yadā bimba uṣṭha sampannaḥ gardabhaḥ sukhitaḥ bhavet
translated: When a donkey becomes well-endowed with bimba-like lips and is happy,

analyzed: kuśalam nṛtya gīteṣu tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When there is skill in dancing and singing, then the element will be present.

analyzed: yadā hi ulūka kākāḥ ca ramayeyuḥ saha āgatāḥ
translated: When owls and crows, having come together, delight in each other,

analyzed: anyonyam anukūlena tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: With mutual favor, then the element will be present.

original: yadā palāśapatrāṇāṃ chatraṃ hi vipulaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yadā palāśa patrāṇām chatram hi vipulam bhavet
translated: When a large umbrella of palāśa leaves becomes

analyzed: varṣasya pratipātāya tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The protector from the rain, then the element will be present.

analyzed: yadā sāmudrikāḥ nāvaḥ sa yantrāḥ sa patākikāḥ
translated: When seafaring ships with their machines and flags

analyzed: sthalam āruhya gaccheyuḥ tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati  /
translated: Ascend the land and move, then the element will be present.

analyzed: yadā hi ulūka śakunāḥ parvatam gandhamādanam
translated: When owls and birds take the Gandhamādana mountain

analyzed: tuṇḍena ādāya gaccheyuḥ tadā dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In their beaks and fly away, then the element will be present.

original: etāśca gāthāḥ śrutvācāryavyākaraṇaprāptaḥ kauṇḍinyo brāhmaṇaḥ sarvalokapriyadarśanaṃ litsavikumāraṃ gāthābhiḥ pratyabhāṣata /
analyzed: etāḥ ca gāthāḥ śrutvā ācārya vyākaraṇa prāptaḥ kauṇḍinyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sarva loka priya darśanam litsavi kumāram gāthābhiḥ pratyabhāṣata
translated: Having heard these verses, the teacher and expounder, the brāhmaṇa Kauṇḍinya, replied to the Licchavi youth Sarvalokapriyadarśana with verses:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu kumāra agra jinaputra mahā gira
translated: Excellent, excellent, O foremost of youths, son of the Victor, great sage!

analyzed: upāya kuśalaḥ vīraḥ prāpta vyākaraṇa uttamaḥ
translated: You, skilled in means, hero, have attained the supreme prediction.

analyzed: mama kumāra śṛṇohi loka nāthasya tāyinaḥ
translated: O youth, listen to me, of the Lord of the World, the Protector,

analyzed: tathāgatasya māhātmyam yathākramam a cintitam
translated: The greatness of the Tathāgata is inconceivable, in due order.

analyzed: acintyam buddha viṣayam asamāḥ ca tathāgatāḥ
translated: The domain of the Buddha is inconceivable, and the Tathāgatas are unequaled.

analyzed: sarva buddhāḥ śivāḥ nityam sarva buddhāḥ samācarāḥ
translated: All Buddhas are always auspicious, all Buddhas are of equal practice.

analyzed: sarva buddhāḥ samavaṇāḥ eṣā buddheṣu dharmatā
translated: All Buddhas are of equal understanding - this is the nature of the Dharma in the Buddhas.

analyzed: na kṛtrimaḥ asau bhagavān na utpannaḥ ca tathāgataḥ
translated: That Blessed One is not artificial, and the Tathāgata is not born.
Having a body with a vajra-like constitution, he manifests a body that is an emanation.

analyzed: nā api sarṣapa mātram ca dhātuḥ nāma mahā ṛṣiṇām
translated: And there is not even as much as a mustard seed of the element of the great sages.

analyzed: an asthi rudhire kāye kutas dhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In a body without flesh and blood, how can there be an element?

analyzed: upāya dhātu nikṣepaḥ sattvānām hita kāraṇam
translated: The deposition of the element of skillful means is for the benefit of beings.

analyzed: dharmakāyaḥ hi sambuddhaḥ dharmadhātuḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The fully enlightened one has the Dharma body, the Tathāgata is the dharmadhātu.

original: idṛśo bhagavatkāya īdṛśī dharmadeśanā // //🔽etacchrutaṃ mayā jñātvābhiyācitaṃ varaṃ mayā /
analyzed: idṛśaḥ bhagavat kāyaḥ īdṛśī dharma deśanā  etat śrutam mayā jñātvā abhiyācitam varam mayā
translated: Such is the body of the Blessed One, such is the teaching of the Dharma.🔽Having heard this and understood, I requested the boon from him.

analyzed: tattva vyākaraṇa arthāya vara utpādam muneḥ kṛtam

translated: The excellent king of sutra-indras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, spoken by all tathāgatas, looked upon by all tathāgatas, possessed by all tathāgatas, bowed to by all assemblies of bodhisattvas, worshipped by all assemblies of devas, delighting all assemblies of deva lords, praised, extolled, and lauded by all world guardians, illuminating all deva palaces, bestowing the highest bliss upon all beings, purifying the sufferings of all hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama, pacifying all fears, turning back all hostile armies, pacifying famines and dangers, destroying illnesses and dangers, illuminating wisdom, bringing supreme peace, pacifying sorrow and toil, pacifying various calamities, destroying hundreds of thousands of calamities.

translated: The Four Great Kings, together with the twenty-eight Yaksha generals and many hundreds of thousands of Yakshas, will always and constantly look upon Jambudvipa with divine, pure, and superhuman vision, protect it, and bring it to maturity.

original: tena hetunā bhadanta bhagavannasmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ lokapāla iti saṃjñotpāditā //

analyzed: yadā ca ime bhadanta bhagavan dharma bhāṇakāḥ bhikṣavaḥ usmākam caturṇām mahārājānām saṃcodanayā buddha adhiṣṭhānena ca yeṣu viṣayeṣu upasaṃkrameyuḥ teṣu te viṣayeṣuḥ ca imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rājam vistareṇa saṃprakāśayeyuḥ
translated: And when, Venerable Blessed One, those Dharma teachers, monks, through our urging and the Buddha's blessing, should come to those lands, in those lands they will extensively illuminate this excellent sutra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa,

analyzed: ye imāni evaṃrūpāṇi viṣaya gata ati nānāvidhāni upadrava śatāni upadrava sahasrāni upadrava śata sahasrāṇi ca praśamayiṣyanti
translated: which will pacify these various hundreds of calamities, thousands of calamities, and hundreds of thousands of calamities that occur in those lands.

original: yasya ca bhadanta bhagavan manuṣyarājasya viṣaye te sūtrendradhārakā bhikṣavā dharmabhāṇākā upasaṃkrāntā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yasya ca bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājasya viṣaye te sūtra indra dhārakāḥ bhikṣavā dharma bhāṇākāḥ upasaṃkrāntāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And, Venerable Blessed One, in whatever human king's realm those monks, Dharma teachers who uphold this sutra, should come,
