analyzed: ayam ca manuṣya rājaḥ imam suvarṇa prabhāsa sūtra indra rājam śṛṇyāt
translated: that human king should listen to this excellent sutra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa.

original: śrutvā ca teṣāṃ sūtrendradhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ sarvapratyarthikebhya ārakṣāṃ kuryāt paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: śrutvā ca teṣām sūtra indra dhārakāṇām bhikṣūṇām sarva pratyarthikebhyaḥ ārakṣām kuryāt paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam kuryāt
translated: And having listened, he should provide protection, refuge, support, and guard for those monks who uphold this sutra against all adversaries.

original: te vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan catvāro mahārājāstasya manuṣyarājasya sarvaviṣayagatānāṃ ca sattvānāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahārājāḥ tasya manuṣya rājasya sarva viṣaya gatānām ca sattvānām ārakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam śānti svastyayanam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We, Venerable Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, will provide protection, rescue, safeguard, and peace and well-being for all beings living in the entire realm of that human king.

original: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan sarvamanuṣyarājaḥ sūtrendradhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānāṃ sarvasukhopadhānaiḥ sukhatāṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan sarva manuṣya rājaḥ sūtra indra dhārakāṇām bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānām sarva sukhopadhānaiḥ sukha tām kuryāt
translated: And when, Venerable Blessed One, the human king provides all forms of happiness to the holders of the Sūtra's essence, the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen,

original: te vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan catvāro mahārājāstaṃ manuṣyarājaṃ sarvarājebhyaḥ satkṛtataraṃ kariṣyāmo gurukṛtaṃ ca kariṣyāmo mānitaṃ ca pūjitaṃ ca sarvaviṣayeṣu ca prasaṃśanīyaṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ tam manuṣya rājam sarva rājebhyaḥ satkṛtataram kariṣyāmaḥ gurukṛtam ca kariṣyāmaḥ mānitam ca pūjitam ca sarva viṣayeṣu ca prasaṃśanīyam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: we, Venerable Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, will honor that human king more than all other kings, we will respect him, esteem him, and worship him, and we will praise him in all the realms.

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān caturṇām mahārājānām sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to the Four Great Kings:

original: sādhu sādhu mahārājāḥ sādhu sādhu yuṣmākaṃ mahārājāḥ /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā rājāḥ sādhu sādhu yuṣmākam mahā rājāḥ
translated: Good, good, Great Kings! Good, good, Great Kings!

original: yathāpi te yūyaṃ pūrvajinakṛtādhikārā avaropitakuśalamūlā bahubuddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraparyupāsitā dharmikāśca dharmavādinaśca dharmeṇa devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca rājatvaṃ kārayadhvam /
analyzed: yathā api te yūyam pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ bahu buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasra paryupāsitāḥ dharmikāḥ ca dharma vādinaḥ ca dharmeṇa devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca rājatvam kārayadhvam
translated: Just as you have previously made offerings to many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas, planted the roots of merit, and been under the care of the buddhas, you are righteous and teach the Dharma, and you rule over the gods and humans righteously.

original: yathāpi pūrvadīrgharātraṃ sarvasattvānāṃ hitacittāḥ sukhamaitrīcittāḥ sarvasattvahitasukhādhyāśayapratipannāḥ sarvāhitapratiṣedhikāḥ sarvasattvānāṃ sarvahitopasaṃhārābhiyuktāḥ /
analyzed: yathā api pūrva dīrgharātram sarva sattvānām hita cittāḥ sukha maitrī cittāḥ sarva sattva hita sukha adhyāśaya pratipannāḥ sarva ahita pratiṣedhikāḥ sarva sattvānām sarva hita upasaṃhāra abhiyuktāḥ
translated: Just as you have for a long time had the intention to benefit all beings, the intention to be loving and friendly, the intention to benefit and bring happiness to all beings, and the intention to prevent all harm, and you are dedicated to gathering all that is beneficial for all beings,

original: te yūyaṃ catvāro mahārājāsteṣāṃ manuṣyarājasya ca suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājasya pūjāsatkārābhiyuktānāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyata paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kariṣyata /
analyzed: te yūyam catvāraḥ mahārājāḥ teṣām manuṣya rājasya ca suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rājasya pūjā satkāra abhiyuktānām ārakṣām kariṣyata paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam śānti svastyayanam kariṣyata
translated: you four great kings will protect, guard, look after, and bring peace and well-being to those human kings who are dedicated to making offerings and serving the excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light.

original: tena yuṣmābhiścaturmahārājaiḥ sabalaparivārairanekaiśca yakṣaśatasahasrairatītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ dharmanetryārakṣitā bhaviṣyati paripālitā ca parigṛhītā ca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena yuṣmābhiḥ catur mahārājaiḥ sa bala parivāraiḥ anekaiḥ ca yakṣa śata sahasraiḥ atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām dharma netrī ārakṣitā bhaviṣyati paripālitā ca parigṛhītā ca bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, you four great kings, together with your armies and retinues, and with many hundreds of thousands of yakshas, will protect, guard, and uphold the Dharma of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, present, and future.

original: tena yuṣmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sabalaparivārāṇamanekeṣāṃ yakṣaśatasahasrāṇāṃ devānāṃ devāsurasaṃgrāme jayo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena yuṣmākam caturṇām mahārājānām sa bala parivārāṇam anekeṣām yakṣa śata sahasrāṇām devānām deva asura saṃgrāme jayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For the sake of the Golden Light, the excellent king of sutra-chants, which crushes all opposing armies, you four great kings, together with your armies and retinues, and with many hundreds of thousands of gods, will gain victory in the battle between the gods and asuras.

analyzed: asurāṇām ca parijayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The asuras will be defeated.

original: sarvaparacakrapramardakasya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājasyārthāya teṣāṃ sūtrendradhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyata paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kariṣyat //
analyzed: sarva para cakra pramardakasya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rājasya arthāya teṣām sūtra indra dhārakāṇām bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānām ārakṣām kariṣyata paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam śānti svastyayanam kariṣyat
translated: For the sake of the Golden Light, the excellent king of sutra-chants, which crushes all opposing armies, you will provide protection, guard, and safety for those monks, nuns, male and female lay followers who uphold this sutra-chant.

original: atha vaiśravaṇo mahārājo dhṛtarāṣṭro mahārājo viruḍhako mahārājo virūpākṣo mahārāja utthāyāsanebhya ekāṃsāni cīvaraiḥ prāvṛtya dakṣiṇāni jānumaṇḍalāni pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocan /
analyzed: atha vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ mahā rājaḥ viruḍhakaḥ mahā rājaḥ virūpākṣaḥ mahā rājaḥ utthāya āsanebhyaḥ eka aṃsāni cīvaraiḥ prāvṛtya dakṣiṇāni jānu maṇḍalāni pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: Then the great king Vaiśravaṇa, the great king Dhṛtarāṣṭra, the great king Virūḍhaka, and the great king Virūpākṣa rose from their seats, put their upper robes over one shoulder, placed their right knees on the ground, joined their palms in reverence toward the Blessed One, and said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: ayam bhadanta bhagavan
translated: Venerable Blessed One,

original: suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājo'nāgate'dhvani yatra grāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīṣu pracariṣyati yasya yasya manuṣyarājasya viṣayamanuprāpto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasūtra indrarāja unāgata idhvani yatra grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīṣu pracariṣyati yasya yasya manuṣya rājasya viṣayam anuprāptaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: this excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, will spread in the future in villages, towns, cities, regions, countries, and capital cities. Wherever this king of sūtras arrives in the realm of a human king,

original: kaścidbhadanta bhagavanmanuṣyarājo bhagavan yenānena devendrasamayena rājaśāsreṇa rājatvaṃ kārayet /
analyzed: kaścid bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājaḥ bhagavan yena anena deva indra samayena rāja śāsreṇa rāja tvam kārayet
translated: if some human king, Blessed One, were to rule by this agreement of the gods, this royal law,

original: asya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya śrotā bhavaṃstāśca sūtrendradhārakā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāḥ satkuryādgurukuryānmānayetpūjayetsatatasamitaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājaṃ śṛṇuyāt /
analyzed: asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya śrotā bhavan tāḥ ca sūtra indra dhārakāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet satata samitam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rājam śṛṇuyāt
translated: Those monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who listen to this king of sūtras, the sublime Golden Light, and uphold this king of sūtras, should honor, respect, esteem, and make offerings to them continuously. They should listen to the king of sūtras, the sublime Golden Light.

original: anena dharmaśravaṇena saṃcodanadharmāmṛtapuṇyātmakānāmasmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sakalaparivārāṇāmanekeṣāṃ ca yakṣarākṣasaśatasahasrāṇāmimān divyātmabhāvān mahataujasā vivardhayet /
analyzed: anena dharma śravaṇena saṃcodana dharma amṛta puṇya ātmakānām asmākam caturṇām mahārājānām sakala parivārāṇām anekeṣām ca yakṣa rākṣasa śata sahasrāṇām imān divya ātmabhāvān mahatā ojasā vivardhayet
translated: By listening to this Dharma, they should inspire us four great kings, our entire retinues, and many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas and rākṣasas to increase our divine bodies with great power.

original: mahāntaṃ vīryaṃ ca sthāma ca balaṃ cāsmākaṃ kāyeṣu tejaḥśriyaśca lakṣmī cāsmākaṃ vivardhayet /
analyzed: mahāntam vīryam ca sthāma ca balam ca asmākam kāyeṣu tejaḥ śriyaḥ ca lakṣmī ca asmākam vivardhayet
translated: They should increase our great strength, power, and vigor, and increase our splendor, glory, and fortune.

original: tena vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃścatvāro mahārājāḥ sabalaparivārā anekaiḥ yakṣaśatasahasrairadṛśyadbhiḥ kāyātmabhāvairetarhi cānāgate'dhvani yatra grāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīṣūpasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ tatrāyaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaḥ sūtrendrarājaḥ pracariṣyati /
analyzed: tena vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ sa bala parivārāḥ anekaiḥ yakṣa śata sahasraiḥ a dṛśyadbhiḥ kāya ātmabhāvaiḥ etarhi ca anāgata idhvani yatra grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīṣu upasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ tatra ayam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sūtra indra rājaḥ pracariṣyati
translated: Therefore, Venerable Blessed One, we four great kings, with our armies and retinues, and with many hundreds of thousands of yakshas invisible in their bodies, will now and in the future go to those villages, towns, cities, countries, kingdoms, and capitals where this excellent king of sutras, the Golden Light, will be practiced.

original: teṣāṃ ca manuṣyarājānāmasya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya śrotṝṇāṃ mātāpitṝṇāṃ cārakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca manuṣya rājānām asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya śrotṝṇām mātā pitṝṇām ca ārakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will provide protection for those human kings who listen to this excellent king of sutras, the Golden Light, and for their mothers and fathers.

original: paritrāṇaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śasraparihāraṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ ca kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: paritrāṇam paripālanam daṇḍa parihāram śasra parihāram śānti svastyayanam ca kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will provide complete protection, complete care, complete defense, removal of punishment, removal of weapons, peace, and well-being.

original: teṣāṃ ca rājakulānāṃ teṣāṃ ca rāṣṭrāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca viṣayāṇāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca rāja kulānām teṣām ca rāṣṭrāṇām teṣām ca viṣayāṇām ārakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will provide protection for those royal families, those countries, and those regions.

original: paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śasraparihāraṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam daṇḍa parihāram śasra parihāram śānti svastyayanam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will provide complete protection, complete care, complete defense, removal of punishment, removal of weapons, peace, and well-being.

original: tāṃśca viṣayān sarvabhayopāyāsebhyaḥ parimocayiṣyāmaḥ paracakrāṇi ca pratinivartayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tān ca viṣayān sarva bhaya upāyāsebhyaḥ parimocayiṣyāmaḥ para cakrāṇi ca pratinivartayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will free those lands from all dangers and calamities, and we will turn back the armies of others.

original: yaḥ kaścit tasya manuṣyarājasya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya śroturmānayituḥ pūjayituranyaḥ sāmantakaḥ pratiśatrurājā bhavet /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid tasya manuṣya rājasya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya śrotuḥ mānayituḥ pūjayituḥ anyaḥ sāmantakaḥ pratiśatru rājā bhavet
translated: If any neighboring hostile king of that human king who listens to, honors, and worships the excellent king of sūtras called The Sūtra of Golden Light should arise,

original: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavaṃstasya sāmantakasya pratiśatro rājña evaṃ cittamutpādet /
analyzed: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan tasya sāmantakasya pratiśatroḥ rājñaḥ evam cittam utpādet
translated: and if, Venerable Blessed One, the mind of that neighboring hostile king should arise thus:

original: so'haṃ caturaṅgena balakāyena sārdhamasya viṣayamupasaṃkrameyaṃ vināśayitum /
analyzed: sā uham caturaṅgena balakāyena sārdham asya viṣayam upasaṃkrameyam vināśayitum
translated: I shall go with my four-fold army to that land to destroy it,

original: tena khalu punarbhadanta bhagavān kālena tena samayenāsya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya tejo'nubhāvena tasya sāmantakasya pratiśatrurājasyānyai rājabhiḥ sārdhaṃ saṃgrāme bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhadanta bhagavān kālena tena samayena asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya tejaḥ anubhāvena tasya sāmantakasya pratiśatru rājasya anyaiḥ rājabhiḥ sārdham saṃgrāme bhaviṣyati
translated: then, Venerable Blessed One, at that time, by the power and splendor of this excellent king of sūtras called The Sūtra of Golden Light, that neighboring hostile king will have a battle with other kings.

analyzed: sva viṣaya gatāḥ ca viṣaya vilopāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will return to their own lands, their lands destroyed.

analyzed: dāruṇāḥ ca rāja saṃkṣobhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And terrible royal disturbances will occur.

analyzed: graha rogāḥ ca viṣaye prādubhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And the planets, diseases, and calamities will appear in the realm.

analyzed: nānā vyākṣepa śatāni viṣaye prādurbhūtāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: And hundreds of various distractions will appear in the realm.

original: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavaṃstasya sāmantakasya pratiśatrurājasya svaviṣayagatānyevaṃrūpāṇi nānopadravaśatāni nānāvyakṣepaśatāni bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan tasya sāmantakasya pratiśatru rājasya sva viṣaya gatāni evaṃrūpāṇi nānā upadrava śatāni nānā vyakṣepa śatāni bhaveyuḥ
translated: And when, Venerable Blessed One, those hundreds of various calamities and hundreds of various distractions occur in the realm of that neighboring hostile king,

original: sa ca bhadanta bhagavan sāmantakapratiśatrurājaścaturaṅgīṇīṃ senāṃ yojayitvā paracakragamanāya svaviṣayānniṣkrānto bhavet /
analyzed: sa ca bhadanta bhagavan sāmantaka pratiśatru rājaḥ caturaṅgīṇīm senām yojayitvā para cakra gamanāya sva viṣayāt niṣkrāntaḥ bhavet
translated: Then, Venerable Blessed One, that neighboring hostile king, having arrayed the four divisions of his army, will set out from his own realm to go to the enemy's realm.

original: yatrāyaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaḥ sutrendrarājo bhavet sa pratiśatrurājaḥ sārdhaṃ caturaṅgabalakāyena taṃ viṣayamupasaṃkramitukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: yatra ayam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sutra indra rājaḥ bhavet sa pratiśatru rājaḥ sārdham caturaṅga balakāyena tam viṣayam upasaṃkramitu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: Wherever this excellent king of sūtras, the Golden Light, is, that neighboring hostile king, together with the four divisions of his army, will wish to approach that realm.

analyzed: tam vināśitu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: He will wish to destroy it.

original: te vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavañcatvāro mahārājāḥ sabalaparivārā anekairyakṣarākṣasaśatasahasrairadṛśyairātmabhāvaistatropasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ taṃ paracakramadhvānaṃ mārgapratipannaṃ tathaiva pratinivartayiṣyāmo nānāvyākṣepaśatāni copasaṃhariṣyāmo vighnāṃśca kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ sa bala parivārāḥ anekaiḥ yakṣa rākṣasa śata sahasraiḥ adṛśyaiḥ ātmabhāvaiḥ tatra upasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ tam para cakram adhvānam mārga pratipannam tathā eva pratinivartayiṣyāmaḥ nānā vyākṣepa śatāni ca upasaṃhariṣyāmaḥ vighnān ca kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We, Venerable Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, together with our armies and retinues, and with many hundreds of thousands of yakshas and rakshasas, will approach there with invisible bodies, and will cause that enemy army, which has set out on the road, to turn back in the same way, and will create many hundreds of distractions and obstacles.

original: yathā ca tatparacakraṃ na śakṣyati tatra viṣaya upasaṃkramitum /
analyzed: yathā ca tat para cakram na śakṣyati tatra viṣaye upasaṃkramitum
translated: And that enemy army will not be able to approach that territory,

analyzed: kutas punar vināśam kariṣyati
translated: let alone destroy it.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃsteṣāṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sādhukāramadāt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām caturṇām mahārājānām sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to those Four Great Kings,

original: sādhu sādhu mahārājāḥ sādhu khalu punaryuṣmākaṃ mahārājānām /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā rājāḥ sādhu khalu punar yuṣmākam mahā rājānām
translated: Good, good it is, O Great Kings, it is truly good of you, O Great Kings,

original: yadyūyamatyā asaṃkhyeyakalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrasamudānītāyā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherarthāya teṣāṃ manuṣyarājānāmasya ca suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya śrotṝṇāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyatha /
analyzed: yat yūyam atyāḥ asaṃkhyeya kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasra samudānītāyāḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ arthāya teṣām manuṣya rājānām asya ca suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya śrotṝṇām ārakṣām kariṣyatha
translated: that you will provide protection for those human kings who listen to this excellent Sutra King of Golden Light, for the sake of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment that has been accomplished over countless millions of eons.

analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam śānti svastyayanam kariṣyatha
translated: You will provide protection, support, and safety, and ensure peace and well-being.

original: tāni ca rājakulāni tāni nagarāṇi tāni ca rāṣṭrāṇi tāni ca viṣayāṇyārakṣayiṣyatha /
analyzed: tāni ca rāja kulāni tāni nagarāṇi tāni ca rāṣṭrāṇi tāni ca viṣayāṇi ārakṣayiṣyatha
translated: You will protect those royal families, those cities, those countries, and those regions.

original: paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śasraparihāraṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kariṣyatha /
analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam daṇḍa parihāram śasra parihāram śānti svastyayanam kariṣyatha
translated: You will provide protection, support, and safety, and ensure peace and well-being by avoiding punishment and weapons.

analyzed: tāni ca viṣayāṇi sarva maya upadrava upasarga apāyāsebhyaḥ parimocayiṣyatha
translated: And you will free those regions from all calamities, misfortunes, and troubles.

analyzed: para cakrāṇi ca nivartayiṣyatha
translated: You will turn back the armies of others.

analyzed: sarva jambudvīpa gatānām ca asya manuṣya rājasya a kalahayā a bhaṇḍanayā a vigrahayā vivādayā autsukyam apapadyatha
translated: And you will strive to ensure that all the people of Jambudvīpa live without quarrels, disputes, conflicts, or arguments with that human king.

original: yathā ca te yuṣmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sabalaparivārāṇāmasmiñjambudvīpe teṣu caturṣu nagarasahasreṣu tāni caturaśītinagarasahasrāṇi teṣu teṣu viṣayeṣvabhirameyustena ca rājyaiśvaryeṇābhirameyustena ca dhanaskandhena parasparaṃ na viheṭhayeyuḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca te yuṣmākam caturṇām mahārājānām sa bala parivārāṇām asmin jambudvīpe teṣu caturṣu nagara sahasreṣu tāni caturaśīti nagara sahasrāṇi teṣu teṣu viṣayeṣu abhirameyuḥ tena ca rājya aiśvaryeṇa abhirameyuḥ tena ca dhana skandhena parasparam na viheṭhayeyuḥ
translated: And you will delight in those four thousand cities in Jambudvīpa, those eighty-four thousand cities, and those regions, and you will delight in that sovereignty and dominion, and you will not harm each other with that wealth.

original: na parasparaṃ viheṭhaṃ janayeyuḥ /🔽svena ca yathā pūrvakarmopacayena rājatvaṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: na parasparam viheṭham janayeyuḥ  svena ca yathā pūrva karma upacayena rāja tvam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: They should not cause harm to each other.🔽They should obtain kingship through their own accumulation of previous karma.

original: svena ca rājyaiśvaryeṇa ca tuṣṭā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: svena ca rājya aiśvaryeṇa ca tuṣṭāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: They should be content with their own kingdom and sovereignty.

analyzed: na ca paraspareṇa vināśayeyuḥ
translated: They should not destroy each other.

analyzed: na viṣeya vināśāya parakrameyuḥ
translated: They should not strive to destroy each other with poison.

original: yathā cāsmiñjambudvīpe teṣu caturaśītiṣu viṣayanagarasahasreṣu tāni caturaśītirāja sahasrāṇi paraspareṇa hitacittāni maitrīcittāni sukhacittāni paraspareṇa kalahayābhaṇḍanayāvigrahayāvivādayā sveṣu sveṣu viṣayeṣvabhiramerantena puṇyena caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sabalaparivārāṇāmayaṃ ca jambudvīpaḥ sphīto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yathā ca asmin jambudvīpe teṣu caturaśītiṣu viṣaya nagara sahasreṣu tāni caturaśīti rāja sahasrāṇi paraspareṇa hita cittāni maitrī cittāni sukha cittāni paraspareṇa kalahayā a bhaṇḍanayā a vigrahayā a vivādayā sveṣu sveṣu viṣayeṣu abhirameran tena puṇyena caturṇām mahārājānām sa bala parivārāṇām ayam ca jambudvīpaḥ sphītaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Just as in this Jambudvīpa and in those eighty-four thousand cities, those eighty-four thousand kings should have a helpful, friendly, and happy mind towards each other, and should enjoy themselves in their own respective kingdoms. By that merit, this Jambudvīpa of the four great kings with their armies and retinues will be prosperous.

analyzed: subhikṣaḥ ca ramaṇīyaḥ ca bahu jana samākīrṇaḥ ca ṛddhaḥ ca ojovataraḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be abundant, pleasant, and full of many people, and will have growth and vigor.

analyzed: ṛtu māsa ardha māsa saṃvatsarāṇi ca sarvāṇi samācāra yuktāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: All the seasons, months, half-months, and years will be conducive to good conduct.

analyzed: ahorātram graha nakṣatra candra sūryāḥ ca samāgrahiṣyanti
translated: The planets, stars, moon, and sun will be in conjunction day and night.

analyzed: kālena ca varṣa dhārāḥ pṛthivyām nipatiṣyanti
translated: And the rain will fall on the earth in due time.

analyzed: sarva jamdu dvīpa gatāni ca sattvāni sarva dhana dhānya samṛddhāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: All the beings in Jambudvīpa will be prosperous with wealth and grain.

analyzed: mahā bhogāni ca amatsarāṇi ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be greatly fortunate and free from stinginess.

analyzed: parityāgavanti daśa kuśala karma patha samanvāgatāni ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be generous and will follow the path of the ten virtues.

analyzed: yat bhūyasā sugatau svarga loke upapatsyante
translated: For the most part, they will be reborn in the higher realms, in the world of the gods.

analyzed: deva bhuvanāni ca ākīrṇāni bhaviṣyanti devaiḥ deva putraiḥ ca
translated: The heavenly realms will be filled with gods and sons of gods.

original: yatkaścinmahārājo bhaved ya itthamasya suvarṇaprabhāsattamasya sūtrendrarājasya śrotā bhavenmānayitā ca pūjayitā ca teṣāṃ ca sūtrendradhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānāmautsukyaṃ satkuryād gurukuryānmānayetpūjayet /
analyzed: yat kaścid mahā rājaḥ bhavet yaḥ ittham asya suvarṇaprabhā sattamasya sūtra indra rājasya śrotā bhavet mānayitā ca pūjayitā ca teṣām ca sūtra indra dhārakāṇām bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānām autsukyam satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet
translated: If there were a great king who became a listener, reverer, and worshiper of this excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, and who out of eagerness would honor, respect, and worship the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās who uphold this excellent sūtra, then, O King, that king would obtain ten great treasures.

original: yuṣmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sabalaparivārāṇāmanekeṣāṃ ca yakṣaśatasahasrāṇāmanukampārthāya satatasamitaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaṃ sūtrendrarājendraṃ śṛṇvan /
analyzed: yuṣmākam caturṇām mahārājānām sa bala parivārāṇām anekeṣām ca yakṣa śata sahasrāṇām anukampā arthāya satata samitam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rāja indram śṛṇvan
translated: For the sake of you four great kings, your armies, your retinues, and many hundreds of thousands of yakshas, you should always listen to the excellent king of sutra kings, the Suvarnaprabhasa, with compassion.

analyzed: anena dharma śravaṇa salila udakena yuṣmākam etāni ātmabhāvāni saṃtarpayet
translated: With the water of listening to this Dharma, you should satisfy these bodies of yours.

analyzed: mahatā ojasā yuṣmākam etāni śarīrāṇi vivardhayet
translated: With great power, you should increase these bodies of yours.

original: mahacca yuṣmākaṃ vīryaṃ ca sthāma balaṃ ca vapuṣaḥ saṃjanayet /
analyzed: mahat ca yuṣmākam vīryam ca sthāma balam ca vapuṣaḥ saṃjanayet
translated: You should generate great vigor, strength, and power in your bodies.

original: tejaśca śriyaśca lakṣmīśca yuṣmākaṃ vivardhayet /🔽tena ca manuṣyarājena mama śākyamunestathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyācintyā mahāvipulavistīrṇā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tejaḥ ca śriyaḥ ca lakṣmīḥ ca yuṣmākam vivardhayet  tena ca manuṣya rājena mama śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya acintyā mahā vipula vistīrṇā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: You should increase your splendor, glory, and grace.🔽And by that human king, an inconceivable, greatly vast and extensive worship will have been made to me, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Shakyamuni.

original: tena tasya manuṣyarājenātītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāmanekeṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ koṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇāmacintyā mahatī vistīrṇā sarvopakaraṇaiḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena tasya manuṣya rājena atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām anekeṣām tathāgatānām koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām acintyā mahatī vistīrṇā sarva upakaraṇaiḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: By that human king, an inconceivable, great and vast worship will have been made with all requisites to many hundreds of thousands of kotis of nayutas of Tathagatas of the past, future, and present.

original: tena tasya manuṣyarājasya mahatyārakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena tasya manuṣya rājasya mahatī ārakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: By that, great protection will have been made for that human king.

original: tena ca tasya rājño rakṣāṃ paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śasraparihāraṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kṛtaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena ca tasya rājñaḥ rakṣām paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam daṇḍa parihāram śasra parihāram śānti svastyayanam kṛtam bhaviṣyati
translated: And for that king, protection, rescue, embracing, guarding, keeping, avoiding punishment, avoiding weapons, peace, and well-being will have been done.

original: agramahiṣyāśca rājaputrāṇāṃ ca sarvāntaḥpurasya ca rājakulasya ca sarvasya mahatyārakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: agramahiṣyāḥ ca rāja putrāṇām ca sarva antaḥpurasya ca rāja kulasya ca sarvasya mahatī ārakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: And great protection will have been made for the chief queen, the princes, the entire harem, and the entire royal family.

original: paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kṛtaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam śānti svastyayanam kṛtam bhaviṣyati
translated: Protection, embracing, guarding, peace, and well-being will have been done.

original: rājakulanivāsanyaśca sarvadevatā ojovattarāśca cittena sukhasaumanasyena samanvāgatā bhavitāro ratimanubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: rāja kula nivāsanyaḥ ca sarva devatāḥ ojovattarāḥ ca cittena sukha saumanasyena samanvāgatāḥ bhavitāraḥ ratim anubhaviṣyanti
translated: And the deities dwelling in the royal palace will become more vigorous, endowed with mental happiness and joy, and will experience delight.

original: tāni ca rāṣṭrāṇi tāni ca viṣayāṇi cārakṣitāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tāni ca rāṣṭrāṇi tāni ca viṣayāṇi ca arakṣitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: And those countries and those regions will be well-protected.

analyzed: paripācitāni ca an utpīḍitāni ca akaṇṭakāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be well-developed, free from oppression, and free from troubles.

analyzed: sarva para cakrāni avamarditāni ca an upasargāṇi ca an upāyāsāni ca iti
translated: They will be unassailable by any foreign armies, free from calamities, and free from afflictions.

original: evamukte vaiśravaṇo mahārājo dhṛtarāṣṭro mahārājo virūḍhako mahārājo virūpākṣo mahārājaste sarve bhagavantametadavocan /
analyzed: evam ukte vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ mahā rājaḥ virūḍhakaḥ mahā rājaḥ virūpākṣaḥ mahā rājaḥ te sarve bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: When this was said, the great kings Vaiśravaṇa, Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Virūḍhaka, and Virūpākṣa all said to the Blessed One:

original: tena ca bhagavanmanuṣyarājena susnātagātreṇa bhavitavyaṃ sugandhavāsanadhāriṇā navaruciravastraprāvṛtena nānālaṃkāravibhūṣitena bhavitavyam
analyzed: tena ca bhagavat manuṣya rājena su snāta gātreṇa bhavitavyam su gandha vāsana dhāriṇā nava rucira vastra prāvṛtena nānā alaṃkāra vibhūṣitena bhavitavyam
translated: Blessed One, that human king should have his body well-bathed, wear fragrant ointments, be dressed in fresh, beautiful garments, and adorned with various ornaments.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca nīcataram āsanam prajñapayitavyam
translated: He should arrange a seat lower than his own.

analyzed: tatra āsane niṣīditvā rājya mada mattena na bhavitavyam
translated: Having sat on that seat, he should not be intoxicated with the pride of his kingdom.

analyzed: na ca uccais rājñā svayam prajñapayitavyam
translated: The king should not himself arrange it too high.

analyzed: śāṭhyamāna mada darpa vivarjitena cittena ayam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sūtra indra rājaḥ śrotavyaḥ
translated: With a mind free from deceit, pride, intoxication, and arrogance, this supreme king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, should be listened to.

analyzed: tasya ca dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ antike śāstṛ saṃjñā utpādayitavyā
translated: And in the presence of that Dharma preacher monk, the notion of a teacher should be aroused.

original: tena manuṣyarājena tasminkāle tasmitsamaye'gramahiṣī rājaputrāśca rājaduhitaraśca sarvāntaḥpuragaṇāśca priyahitābhyāṃ prekṣitavyāḥ /
analyzed: tena manuṣya rājena tasmin kāle tasmin samaye agra mahiṣī rāja putrāḥ ca rāja duhitaraḥ ca sarva antaḥpura gaṇāḥ ca priya hitābhyām prekṣitavyāḥ
translated: At that time, at that moment, by that human king, the chief queen, the princes, the princesses, and all the harem women should be looked upon with love and benefit.

analyzed: priya vacanaiḥ ca agra mahiṣī rāja putrāḥ ca rāja duhitaraḥ ca sarva antaḥpura gaṇāḥ ca ālapayitavyāḥ
translated: He should speak pleasantly to the chief queen, the princes, the princesses, and all the women of the palace.

analyzed: nānā vicitrāḥ ca dharma śravaṇa pūjāḥ ājñāpayitavyāḥ  acintyayā atulyayā prītyā ātmānam saṃtarpayitavyam
translated: He should order various kinds of Dharma teachings and offerings to be made.🔽He should satisfy himself with inconceivable and incomparable joy.

analyzed: acintyena prīti sukhena sukhāpayitavyam
translated: He should make himself happy with inconceivable joyful bliss.

analyzed: sukha indriyeṇa ca bhavitavyam
translated: He should have the faculty of pleasure.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca mahā balena bhavitavyam
translated: He should have great strength in himself.

analyzed: mahatā praharṣeṇa ātmā praharṣayitavyaḥ
translated: He should delight himself with great joy.

analyzed: mahatā prema jātena dharma bhāṇakaḥ pratyutthātavyaḥ
translated: With great love born, he should rise up to greet the Dharma teacher.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān tān caturaḥ mahā rājān etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to those four great kings:

original: tasmiṃśca khalu pugarmahārajāḥ kāle tasminsamaye tena manuṣyarājena sarvaśvetāni pāṇḍurāṇi navarucivastrāṇi prāvaritavyāni /
analyzed: tasmin ca khalu pugar mahārajāḥ kāle tasmin samaye tena manuṣya rājena sarva śvetāni pāṇḍurāṇi nava ruci vastrāṇi prāvaritavyāni
translated: At that time, O great kings, that human king should put on all-white, pure, new, beautiful garments,

analyzed: nānā vibhūṣaṇa alaṃkāraiḥ ātmā samalaṃkartavyam
translated: and adorn himself with various ornaments and decorations.

original: mahatā rājānubhāvena mahatā rājavyūhena nānāvicitraratnamaṅgalaparigṛhītaistato rājakulādabhiniṣkramitavyam /
analyzed: mahatā rāja anubhāvena mahatā rāja vyūhena nānā vicitra ratna maṅgala parigṛhītaiḥ tatas rājakulāt abhiniṣkramitavyam
translated: He should leave the royal palace with great royal splendor and great royal pomp, holding various kinds of precious and auspicious things,

original: tasya ca dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ pratyudgamanāya gantavyam /
analyzed: tasya ca dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ pratyudgamanāya gantavyam
translated: and go to meet that Dharma teacher monk.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yāvanti manuṣyarājastatra padāni bhāvayati tāvanti kalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi saṃsārātparāṅmukhāni kariṣyati tāvatāṃ cakravartirājakulakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yāvanti manuṣya rājaḥ tatra padāni bhāvayati tāvanti kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃsārāt parāṅmukhāni kariṣyati tāvatām cakravarti rāja kula koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām lābhī bhaviṣyati
translated: For as many steps that human king takes there, he will turn away from saṃsāra for that many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas, and he will obtain that many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of royal families of world-emperors.

original: yāvanti sa tatra padānyatikramiṣyati tāvatāṃ caiva dṛṣṭadhārmikeṇācintyena mahatā rājyaiśvaryeṇa vivardhiṣyate /
analyzed: yāvanti sa tatra padāni atikramiṣyati tāvatām ca eva dṛṣṭa dhārmikeṇa acintyena mahatā rājya aiśvaryeṇa vivardhiṣyate
translated: For as many steps as he takes there, he will increase his inconceivable and vast royal power in this very life by that much.

analyzed: aneka kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām udāra udārāṇām ca avasthānānām sapta ratna mayānām divya vimānānām lābhī bhaviṣyati
translated: He will obtain divine palaces made of the seven precious substances, vast and magnificent for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas.

original: anekeṣāṃ ca divyodārāṇāṃ mānuṣyakāṇāṃ rājakulaputraśatasahasrāṇāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anekeṣām ca divya udārāṇām mānuṣyakāṇām rāja kula putra śata sahasrāṇām lābhī bhaviṣyati
translated: He will obtain many hundreds of thousands of royal sons, divine and magnificent, and many hundreds of thousands of royal sons, human and magnificent.

analyzed: sarvatra ca jātiṣu mahā aiśvarya prāptaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And in all his births he will attain great prosperity.

analyzed: dīrgha āyuṣkaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will have a long life.

analyzed: ciraṃjīvī ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will live a long time.

analyzed: pratibhāṇavān ca ādeya vacanaḥ ca yaśasvī ca su viśāla kīrtiḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be eloquent and his words will be accepted. He will be famous and have a very extensive reputation.

analyzed: sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya sukhitaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be happy in the world of gods, humans, and asuras.

original: udārodārāṇāṃ ca divyamānuṣyakāṇāṃ sukhānāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: udāra udārāṇām ca divya mānuṣyakāṇām sukhānām lābhī bhaviṣyati
translated: He will obtain the most excellent divine and human pleasures.

original: mahābalaśca mahānagnabalavegadhārī cābhirūpaḥ prāsādiko darśanīyaḥ paramayā śubhavarṇapuṣkaratayā samanvāgataśca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mahā balaḥ ca mahā nagna bala vega dhārī ca abhirūpaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ paramayā śubha varṇa puṣkara tayā samanvāgataḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will have great strength and will possess the power and speed of a great fire. He will be handsome, pleasing, and beautiful, endowed with the highest auspicious complexion and excellence.

analyzed: sarvatra jātiṣu tathāgata samavadhāna gataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In all his births he will be in the presence of the Tathagata.

analyzed: sarva kalyāṇa mitrāṇi ca pratilapsyate
translated: He will obtain all spiritual friends.

analyzed: aparimita puṇya skandhasya parigṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be embraced by an immeasurable accumulation of merit.

original: imanyevaṃrūpāṇi mahārājaguṇānuśaṃsāni saṃpaśyamānena tena rājñā dharmabhāṇako yojanātpratyutthātavyaḥ /
analyzed: imani evaṃrūpāṇi mahā rāja guṇa anuśaṃsāni saṃpaśyamānena tena rājñā dharmabhāṇakaḥ yojanāt pratyutthātavyaḥ
translated: Seeing these great royal qualities and benefits, the king should rise up to greet the Dharma teacher from a distance of one league.

analyzed: tasya dharmabhāṇakasya antike śāstṛ saṃjñā utpādayitavyā
translated: Toward that Dharma teacher, the notion of a teacher should be generated.

original: evaṃ cittamutpādayitavyam /🔽adya mama śākyamunistathāgato'rhansamyaksaṃbuddha iha rājakule pravekṣyati /
analyzed: evam cittam utpādayitavyam  adya mama śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ urhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iha rājakule pravekṣyati
translated: And this thought should be generated:🔽Today the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, will enter this royal family.

original: adya mama śākyamunistathāgato'rhansamyaksaṃbuddha iha rājakule svajanamanuśasiṣyate /
analyzed: adya mama śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ urhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iha rājakule sva janam anuśasiṣyate
translated: Today the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, will instruct his own relatives in this royal family.

analyzed: sarva loka vipratyayanīyam dharma śravaṇam śroṣyāmi
translated: I will hear the Dharma teaching that is contrary to the beliefs of the whole world.

analyzed: adya aham anena dharma śravaṇena avaivartikaḥ bhaviṣyāmi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Today, by this Dharma teaching, I will become irreversible from supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: adya mayā tathāgata koṭī niyuta śata śasrāṇi ārāgitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will please many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of tathāgatas.

original: adya mayātītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmacintyā mahatī vipulā vistīrṇā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: adya mayā atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām acintyā mahatī vipulā vistīrṇā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: Today I will make inconceivable, great, vast, extensive offerings to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present.

analyzed: adya mama naraka gati tiryagyoni yama loka duḥkhāni antaśas samucchinnāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today the sufferings of the hells, animal wombs, and the world of Yama will be completely cut off for me.

original: adya mayānekānāṃ brahmendrarājatvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrātmabhāvapratilabdhānāṃ kuśalamūlabījānyavaropitāni bhaviṣyanti /🔽adya mayānekānāṃ śakrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrātmabhāvapratilabdhānāṃ kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: adya mayā anekānām brahma indra rāja tva koṭī niyuta śata sahasra ātmabhāva pratilabdhānām kuśala mūla bījāni avaropitāni bhaviṣyanti  adya mayā anekānām śakra koṭī niyuta śata sahasra ātmabhāva pratilabdhānām kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will plant the seeds of the roots of virtue for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Brahmakāyika kings who have attained their bodies.🔽Today I will plant the roots of virtue for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Śakras who have attained their bodies.

analyzed: adya mayā anekāni cakravarti rāja koṭī niyuta śata sahasra ātmabhāva pratilabdhānām kuśala mūla bījāni avaropitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will plant the seeds of the roots of virtue for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of wheel-turning kings who have attained their bodies.

analyzed: adya mayā sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃsārāt parimocitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will liberate many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings from saṃsāra.

analyzed: adya mayā acintya su vipula vistīrṇa a pāramita puṇya skandhaḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will attain an inconceivable, extremely vast, immeasurable heap of merit.

original: adya mama sarvāntaḥpurasya mahatyārakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: adya mama sarva antaḥpurasya mahatī ārakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will have great protection for my entire harem.

original: adya mama rājakule'cintyā samabiśiṣṭānuttarā mahatī śāntiḥ kṛtā bhaviṣyati svastyayanaṃ ca /
analyzed: adya mama rāja kule cintyā sama biśiṣṭa anuttarā mahatī śāntiḥ kṛtā bhaviṣyati svastyayanam ca
translated: Today in my royal family an inconceivable, excellent, unsurpassed, great peace and well-being will be accomplished.

analyzed: adya mama ayam sarva viṣayaḥ ārakṣitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Today this entire realm of mine will be protected.

analyzed: paripālitaḥ ca an utpīḍitaḥ ca an utkaṇṭhikaḥ ca sarva para cakra an avamarditaḥ ca an upasargaḥ ca an upāyāsaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be protected, not oppressed, not anxious, not conquered by any foreign army, not afflicted by any misfortune, and not afflicted by any calamity.”

original: yadā ca mahārājāḥ sa manuṣyarājo'nenaivaṃrūpeṇa saddharmagauraveṇa suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājadhārakā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāḥ satkuryādgurukuryānmānayedyuṣmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sabalaparivārāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca devagaṇānāmanekeṣāṃ ca yakṣaśatasahasrāṇāṃ mahā tathā dharmāṅgapratyakṣaṃ dadyāt yena caivāsau manuṣyarājaḥ puṇyabhisaṃskāreṇa kuśalābhisaṃskāreṇa ca tenaiva cātmabhāvena ca dṛṣṭadhārmikeṇācintyena mahatā rājyaiśvaryeṇa vivardhayiṣyati dṛṣṭadhārmikeṇācintyena mahatā rājatejasā samanvāgato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadā ca mahā rājāḥ sa manuṣya rājaḥ unena evaṃrūpeṇa saddharma gauraveṇa suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasūtra indra rāja dhārakāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet yuṣmākam caturṇām mahā rājānām sa bala parivārāṇām teṣām ca deva gaṇānām anekeṣām ca yakṣa śata sahasrāṇām mahā tathā dharma aṅga pratyakṣam dadyāt yena ca eva asau manuṣya rājaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāreṇa kuśala abhisaṃskāreṇa ca ten
translated: “Great kings, when that human king, with such reverence for the true Dharma, honors, venerates, and worships the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās who uphold the Sūtra of Golden Light, the king of sūtras, he will give you, the four great kings with your armies and retinues, and the hosts of gods and many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas, a great Dharma gift, a direct experience of the Dharma. By that very meritorious formation and wholesome formation, and by that very body, he will increase his inconceivable and vast royal power and sovereignty in this very life. He will be endowed with the inconceivable and vast royal splendor of a king in this very life.

original: śriyā ca tejasā ca lakṣmyā cālaṃkṛto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: śriyā ca tejasā ca lakṣmyā ca alaṃkṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be adorned with glory, splendor, and beauty.”

analyzed: sarva pratyarthikāḥ ca sarva śatravaḥ ca sahadharmeṇa su nigṛhītāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And all adversaries and enemies will be well restrained by the Dharma.”

analyzed: evam ukte catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: When this was said, the Four Great Kings said to the Blessed One:

original: yaḥ kaścidbhadanta bhagavanmanuṣyarājo bhavet so'nenaivaṃrūpeṇa dharmagauraveṇemaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaṃ sūtrendrarājaṃ śṛṇuyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājaḥ bhavet saḥ unena evaṃrūpeṇa dharma gauraveṇa imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rājam śṛṇuyāt
translated: “Reverend Blessed One, whatever human king there may be who would listen to this excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, with such an attitude of Dharma reverence,

analyzed: tāḥ ca sūtra indra dhārakāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet
translated: and would honor, respect, esteem, and worship those monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who uphold this king of sūtras,

original: asmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāmarthāya tadrājakulaṃ suśodhitaṃ śodhayet /
analyzed: asmākam caturṇām mahārājānām arthāya tat rājakulam su śodhitam śodhayet
translated: and for our sake, the Four Great Kings, would have that royal palace well-cleaned and cleaned,

analyzed: nānā gandha udaka saṃsiktam kuryāt
translated: and would have it sprinkled with water mixed with various fragrances,

original: taṃ ca dharmaśrāvaṇamasmābhiścaturbhiśca mahārājaiḥ sārdhaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ śṛṇyādātmano'rthāya sarvadevatā ca kiṃcinmātraṃ kuśalaṃ pratyakṣaṃ dadyāt
analyzed: tam ca dharmaśrāvaṇam asmābhiḥ caturbhiḥ ca mahārājaiḥ sārdham sādhāraṇam śṛṇyāt ātmanaḥ orthāya sarva devatā ca kiṃcid mātram kuśalam pratyakṣam dadyāt
translated: and would listen to that Dharma discourse together with us, the Four Great Kings, for his own sake, and would give to all the deities a small portion of merit as a direct gift,

original: samantaraniṣaṇṇasya ca bhadanta bhagavaṃstasya bhikṣordhamāsanagatasya tena manuṣyarājenāsmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāmarthāya nānāgandhā dhūpayitavyāḥ
analyzed: samantara niṣaṇṇasya ca bhadanta bhagavan tasya bhikṣoḥ dham āsana gatasya tena manuṣya rājena asmākam caturṇām mahā rājānām arthāya nānā gandhāḥ dhūpayitavyāḥ
translated: Venerable Blessed One, as soon as that monk has sat down on the prepared seat, for the sake of us four great kings, various fragrances should be burned.

original: sahadhūpiteṣu bhadanta bhagavaṃstasya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya pūjārthāya nānāgandheṣu nānāgandhadhūpalatā niścaranti /
analyzed: saha dhūpiteṣu bhadanta bhagavan tasya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya pūjā arthāya nānā gandheṣu nānā gandha dhūpa latāḥ niścaranti
translated: Venerable Blessed One, when those various fragrances are burned for the sake of worshipping the excellent king of sūtras called the Golden Light, various fragrant smoke-clouds will emerge from those various fragrances.

original: tasminneva kṣaṇalavamuhūrte'smākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ svakasvakabhavanagatānyuparyantarīkṣe nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /🔽udārāṃśca gandhānāghrāsyanti /
analyzed: tasmin eva kṣaṇa lava muhūrte smākam caturṇām mahārājānām svaka svaka bhavana gatāni upari antarīkṣe nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti  udārān ca gandhān āghrāsyanti
translated: In that very moment, instant, and second, above our own palaces, various fragrant smoke-cloud canopies will appear for us four great kings.🔽We will smell those excellent fragrances.

analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa mayāḥ ca avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: Golden-colored lights will appear.

analyzed: tena ca avabhāsena asmākam bhavanāni avabhāsitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: By that light, our palaces will be illuminated.

original: brahmaṇaḥ sahāṃpateḥ śakrasya ca devānāmindrasya sarasvatyāśca mahādevyā dṛḍhāyāśca mahādevyāḥ śriyaśca mahādevyāḥ saṃjayasya ca mahāyakṣasenāpateraṣṭāviṃśatīnāṃ ca mahāyakṣasenāpatīnaṃ maheśvarasya ca devaputrasya bajrapāṇeśca mahāyakṣasenāpatermāṇibhadrasya ca mahāyakṣasenāpaterhārītyāśca pañcaputraśataparivārāṇāmanavataptasya ca nāgarājasya caiteṣāṃ bhadanta bhagavansvakasvakabhavanagatānām /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ sahāṃpateḥ śakrasya ca devānām indrasya sarasvatyāḥ ca mahādevyāḥ dṛḍhāyāḥ ca mahādevyāḥ śriyaḥ ca mahādevyāḥ saṃjayasya ca mahā yakṣa senāpateḥ aṣṭāviṃśatīnām ca mahā yakṣa senāpatīn maheśvarasya ca devaputrasya bajrapāṇeḥ ca mahā yakṣa senāpateḥ māṇibhadrasya ca mahā yakṣa senāpateḥ hārītyāḥ ca pañca putra śata parivārāṇām anavataptasya ca nāga rājasya ca eteṣām bhadanta bhagavan svaka svaka bhava
translated: Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, Śakra, lord of the gods, the great goddess Sarasvatī, the great goddess Dṛḍhā, the great goddess Śrī, the great general of the yakṣas Saṃjaya, the twenty-eight great generals of the yakṣas, the god Maheśvara, the great general of the yakṣas Vajrapāṇi, the great general of the yakṣas Maṇibhadra, Hārītī with her retinue of five hundred sons, and the nāga king Anavatapta - to these, O Venerable Blessed One, in their own abodes,

analyzed: tena kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena upari antarīkṣe nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: in that very moment, instant, and second, parasols made of various fragrant incense creepers will be established in the upper atmosphere.

analyzed: udārān ca nānā gandhān āghrāsyanti
translated: They will smell various sublime fragrances.

analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa mayāḥ ca avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: And golden-colored lights will appear.

analyzed: tayā ca avabhāsayā sarva bhavanāni avabhāsitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: And by that light, all the abodes will be illuminated.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān caturaḥ mahā rājān etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the Four Great Kings:

original: na kevalaṃ yuṣmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ svakasvakabhavanagatānāmuparyantarīkṣagatāti nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /
analyzed: na kevalam yuṣmākam caturṇām mahārājānām svaka svaka bhavana gatānām upari antarīkṣa gatā ati nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: “Not only will canopies of various fragrant incense creepers appear in the sky above your own palaces, O four great kings.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sahapradhūpitāśca mahārājāstena manuṣyarājena nānāgandhā asya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya pūjopasthānāya /
analyzed: saha pradhūpitāḥ ca mahā rājāḥ tena manuṣya rājena nānā gandhāḥ asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya pūjā upasthānāya
translated: Because, O great kings, the human king who has lit those incenses will have offered various fragrances to this excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, in order to worship and serve it.

analyzed: tatas ca eva dhūpa kuṇḍa hasta parigṛhītāḥ nānā gandha dhūpa latāḥ niścariṣyanti
translated: And from those incense burners held in his hands, various fragrant incense creepers will emerge.

original: tena kṣaṇalavamuhūrtena sarvasyāmasyāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau yatra koṭīśataṃ candrāṇāṃkoṭīśataṃ sumerūṇāṃ parvatarājānāṃ koṭīśataṃ cakravāḍamahācakravāḍānāṃ parvatarājānāṃ koṭīśataṃ caturmahādvīpānāṃ koṭīśataṃ caturmahārājakāyikānāṃ devānāṃ koṭīśataṃ trayastriṃśānāṃ devānāṃ koṭīśataṃ yāvannaivasaṃjñāyatanopagānāṃ devānām /
analyzed: tena kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena sarvasyām asyām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau yatra koṭī śatam candrāṇām koṭī śatam sumerūṇām parvata rājānām koṭī śatam cakravāḍa mahācakravāḍānām parvata rājānām koṭī śatam catur mahādvīpānām koṭī śatam catur mahārājakāyikānām devānām koṭī śatam trayastriṃśānām devānām koṭī śatam yāvat na eva saṃjñā āyatana upagānām devānām
translated: In that very instant, in this entire great trichiliocosm, where there are a hundred million moons, a hundred million Sumerus, kings of mountains, a hundred million Cakravāḍas and Mahācakravāḍas, kings of mountains, a hundred million four-continent worlds, a hundred million gods of the Four Great Kings, a hundred million gods of the Thirty-Three, up to a hundred million gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: sarvatra ca teṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātukoṭīśateṣu trayastriṃśeṣu devanikāyeṣu sarveṣāṃ ca devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakiṃnaramahoragāṇāṃ ca bhavanagatānāṃ coparyantarīkṣagatāni nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /🔽udārāṃśca nānāgandhānāghrāsyanti /
analyzed: sarvatra ca teṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu koṭī śateṣu trayastriṃśeṣu devanikāyeṣu sarveṣām ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kiṃnara mahoragāṇām ca bhavana gatānām ca upari antarīkṣa gatāni nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti  udārān ca nānā gandhān āghrāsyanti
translated: And in all those hundreds of koṭis of worlds in the great trichiliocosm, in the thirty-three celestial realms, and in the abodes of all the devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, parasols made of various fragrant incense vines will appear in the sky above.🔽They will smell the most excellent of various fragrances.

analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa mayāḥ ca avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: Golden-colored lights will appear.

analyzed: tābhiḥ ca avabhāsābhiḥ sarva bhavanāni avabhāsitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those lights will illuminate all the abodes.

analyzed: ratna chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: Jewelled parasols will appear.

analyzed: udāra udārān ca gandhān āghrāsyanti sarva deva bhavaneṣu suvarṇa varṇa avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: In all the deva abodes, golden-colored lights will appear.

analyzed: tena ca avabhāsena sarva deva bhavanāni avabhāsitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those lights will illuminate all the deva abodes.

original: yathā trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau sarvadevabhavanānyuparyantarīkṣe tāni nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /
analyzed: yathā tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau sarva deva bhavanāni upari antarīkṣe tāni nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: Just as those parasols made of various fragrant incense vines will appear in the sky above all the deva abodes in the great trichiliocosm,

original: tathā cāsya mahārājāḥ suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya tejasā kuṇḍahastena dhūpitāstena manuṣyarājena nānāgandhā asya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya pūjārthāya nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /
analyzed: tathā ca asya mahā rājāḥ suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya tejasā kuṇḍa hastena dhūpitāḥ tena manuṣya rājena nānā gandhāḥ asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya pūjā arthāya nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: And by the splendor of this king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, the incense of Kuṇḍa will be perfumed by that human king, for the sake of making offerings to this king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light. Various incense and incense-smoke canopies will be established.

original: tena kṣaṇalavamuhūrtena samantāddaśasu dikṣvanekeṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu buddhakṣetrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasreṣvanekeṣāṃ gaṅgānadīvālukāsamānāṃ tathāgatakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇāmuparyantarīkṣe tāni nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /
analyzed: tena kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena samantāt daśasu dikṣu anekeṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu buddhakṣetra koṭī niyuta śata sahasreṣu anekeṣām gaṅgā nadī vālukā samānām tathāgata koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām upari antarīkṣe tāni nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: In that moment, instant, and brief instant, in the ten directions, in many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, in many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of tathāgatas equal to the sands of the Ganges, those various incense and incense-smoke canopies will be established in the sky above.

analyzed: teṣu vālukā upameṣu buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasreṣu udāra udārān nānā gandha dhūpān āghrāsyanti
translated: In those many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, they will smell the most sublime various incenses and incense-smoke.

analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa maya avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: Golden-colored light will appear.

analyzed: tena ca avabhāsena tāni anekāni gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāni buddhakṣetra koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi a bhāsitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: And by that light, those many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges will be illuminated.

original: samanantaraprādurbhūtāni ca mahārājā imānyevaṃrūpāṇi mahāprātihāryāṇi tānyanekāni gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāni buddhakṣetrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi pratiṣṭhitāstathāgatāstaṃ ca dharmabhāṇakaṃ samanvāhariṣyanti /🔽sādhukārāṇi ca pradāsyanti sādhu sādhu satpuruṣa sādhu punastvaṃ satpuruṣa /
analyzed: samanantara prādurbhūtāni ca mahā rāja imāni evaṃrūpāṇi mahā prātihāryāṇi tāni anekāni gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāni buddhakṣetra koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi pratiṣṭhitāḥ tathāgatāḥ tam ca dharma bhāṇakam samanvāhariṣyanti  sādhukārāṇi ca pradāsyanti sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa sādhu punar tvam sat puruṣa
translated: “Great kings, immediately after the appearance of these great miracles, which are of such a kind, there will be many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhafields, as numerous as the sands in the Ganges River, and the tathāgatas who are in those buddhafields will think of that dharmabhāṇaka.

original: yastvamimamevaṃrūpaṃ gambhīramevaṃ gambhīrārthamevaṃ gambhīrāvabhāsamevamacintyaguṇadharmasamanvāgataṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaṃ sūtrendrarājaṃ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayitukāmaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tvam imam evaṃrūpam gambhīram evam gambhīra artham evam gambhīra avabhāsam evam acintya guṇa dharma samanvāgatam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rājam vistareṇa saṃprakāśayitu kāmaḥ
translated: They will give their approval, saying, ‘Excellent, excellent, good man! Excellent, good man, that you wish to teach in detail this king of sūtras, this good, pure, and clear conduct, this good, pure, and clear path, this good, pure, and clear wisdom, this good, pure, and clear knowledge, this good, pure, and clear insight, this good, pure, and clear illumination, this good, pure, and clear light, this good, pure, and clear lamp, this good, pure, and clear banner, this good, pure, and clear crest-jewel, this good, pure, and clear armor, this good, pure, and clear weapon, this good, pure, and clear vehicle, this good, pure, and clear king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, which is so profound, has such a profound meaning, such a profound illumination, and possesses such inconceivable qualities.’

original: na caite sattvā itareṇa kuśalamūlena samanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na ca ete sattvāḥ itareṇa kuśala mūlena samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those beings will not possess the roots of virtue of others.

analyzed: ye imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rājam antaśas śroṣyanti
translated: Those who will hear this king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, even just once,

original: prāgevodgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti likhiṣyanti likhāpayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti /
analyzed: prāk eva udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti likhiṣyanti likhāpayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: let alone those who will take it up, bear it in mind, write it, cause it to be written, recite it, and master it.”

original: vistareṇa parṣadi saṃprakāśayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāyiṣyanti yoniśo manasi bhāvayiṣyanti /
analyzed: vistareṇa parṣadi saṃprakāśayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāyiṣyanti yoniśas manasi bhāvayiṣyanti
translated: They will teach it, explain it, recite it, and contemplate it correctly in the assemblies in detail.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sahaśravaṇenāsya puruṣasya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasyānekāni bodhisattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyavaivartikāni bhaviṣyantyanuttarāyāḥ samyaksabodheḥ //
analyzed: saha śravaṇena asya puruṣasya suvarṇaprabhāsa uttamasya sūtrendra rājasya anekāni bodhisattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi a vaivartikāni bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyāḥ samyaksabodheḥ
translated: As soon as this man hears the excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of bodhisattvas will become irreversible from highest genuine full awakening.

original: atha khalu tāni samantāddaśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu buddhakṣetrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasreṣvanekāni tathāgatakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi svakasvakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pratiṣṭhitāni tena kālena tena samayenaikapādenaikavācaikasvaranirghoṣeṇa tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣordharmāsanagatasyaitadūcuḥ upasaṃkramiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣānāgate'dhvani bodhimaṇḍam /
analyzed: atha khalu tāni samantāt daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu buddhakṣetra koṭī niyuta śata sahasreṣu anekāni tathāgata koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pratiṣṭhitāni tena kālena tena samayena eka pādena eka vācā eka svara nirghoṣeṇa tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ dharma āsana gatasya etat ūcuḥ upasaṃkramiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa anāgata idhvani bodhimaṇḍam bodhimaṇḍam bodhimaṇḍam bodhimaṇḍam bodhimaṇ
translated: Then indeed, at that time, at that moment, those many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of tathāgatas established in their own buddha-fields in the ten directions, in buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, with one foot, with one voice, with one sound, said this to that dharma-expounding bhikṣu who was seated on the dharma seat: You will approach the seat of awakening in the future, O good man.

original: pradarśayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣa bodhimaṇḍavarāgragato drumarājamūlopaviṣṭaḥ sarvatrailokyaprativiśiṣṭāni sarvasattvāṃstrikālāntarāṇi vratatapaścaraṇabalādhānānyadhiṣṭhānānyadhiṣṭhitānyanekāni duṣkarakalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi samalaṃkariṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣa bodhimaṇḍam /
analyzed: pradarśayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gataḥ drumarāja mūla upaviṣṭaḥ sarva trailokya prativiśiṣṭāni sarva sattvān tri kāla antarāṇi vrata tapaḥ caraṇa bala ādhānāni adhiṣṭhānāni adhiṣṭhitāni anekāni duṣkara kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi samalaṃkariṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa bodhimaṇḍam
translated: You will display, O good man, having gone to the excellent seat of enlightenment, seated at the foot of the tree-king, all the superiorities over the entire threefold world, all the practices of austerities and the attainments of strength, the many bases that are established, the many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of difficult practices.

analyzed: paritrāyiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa sarvān tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātūn
translated: You will protect, O good man, all those in the great trichiliocosm.

original: parājayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣa drumarājamūlopaviṣṭaḥ kṛtimarūpaparamabībhatsadarśanaṃ nānāvikṛtarūpamacintyamārasainyam /
analyzed: parājayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa drumarāja mūla upaviṣṭaḥ kṛtima rūpa parama bībhatsa darśanam nānā vikṛta rūpam acintya māra sainyam
translated: You will defeat, O good man, having sat at the foot of the tree-king, the inconceivable army of Māra, with its forms of accomplishment, its most terrifying appearances, its various distorted forms.

analyzed: abhisaṃbhotsyasi tvam sat puruṣa bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gataḥ unupama praśānta virajaska gambhīrām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: You will fully awaken, O good man, having gone to the excellent seat of enlightenment, to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, which is incomparable, peaceful, dust-free, and profound.

original: pravartayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣāryasāradṛḍhavajrāsanopaviṣṭaḥ sarvajanābhisaṃstutaṃ paramagambhīraṃ dvādaśākāramanuttaradharmacakram /
analyzed: pravartayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa ārya sāra dṛḍha vajra āsana upaviṣṭaḥ sarva jana abhisaṃstutam parama gambhīram dvādaśa ākāram anuttara dharmacakram
translated: You will turn the supreme, unsurpassed wheel of Dharma, which is praised by all people, and which is extremely profound and has twelve aspects, while sitting on the seat of truth, which is firm like a vajra, O good man.

original: parāhaniṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣānuttaraṃ dharmagañjavādyam /🔽āpūrayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣānuttaraṃ mahādharmaśaṅkham /
analyzed: parāhaniṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa anuttaram dharmagañjavādyam  āpūrayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa anuttaram mahā dharma śaṅkham
translated: You will beat the unsurpassed drum of the Dharma treasure, O good man.🔽You will blow the unsurpassed great Dharma conch, O good man.

original: ucchrayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣa mahādharmadhvajam /🔽prajvalayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣānuttarāṃ dharmolkām /
analyzed: ucchrayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa mahā dharma dhvajam  prajvalayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa anuttarām dharma ulkām
translated: You will raise the great Dharma banner, O good man.🔽You will light the unsurpassed Dharma torch, O good man.

analyzed: pravarṣayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa anuttaram mahā dharma varṣam
translated: You will rain down the unsurpassed great Dharma rain, O good man.

original: parājayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣanekāni kleśaśatasahasrāṇi /🔽pratārayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣānekāni sattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi subhīmānmahābhayasamudrāt /🔽parimocayiṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣānekāni sattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi saṃsāracakrāt /
analyzed: parājayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa nekāni kleśa śata sahasrāṇi  pratārayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣān ekāni sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi su bhīmāt mahā bhaya samudrāt  parimocayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣān ekāni sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃsāra cakrāt
translated: You will defeat many hundreds of thousands of afflictions, O good man.🔽You will deliver many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings from the great and terrifying ocean of fear, O good man.🔽You will liberate many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings from the cycle of birth and death, O good man.

analyzed: ārāgayiṣyasi tvam sat puruṣān ekāni tathāgata koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: You will please many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of Tathagatas, O good man.

analyzed: evam ukte catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: When this was said, the Four Great Kings said to the Blessed One:

original: asya bhadanta bhagavansuvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasyemānyevaṃrūpāṇi dṛpdhārmikāṇi māraparājayikāni ca guṇāni saṃpaśyamānasya buddhasahasrāvaruptakuśalamūlasya manuṣyarājasyānukampāccāparimitapuṇyaskandhaparigrahaṃ saṃpaśyamānāste vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃścatvāro mahārājāḥ sabalaparivārā anekairyakṣaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ svabhavanagatā nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāḥ saṃcoditāḥ samānā adṛśyairātmabhāvairyena tasya manuṣyarājasyopagatasaṃskārakūṭasuśodhitaṃ nānāgandhodakasusaṃsiktaṃ nānālaṃkārasamalaṃkṛtaṃ rājakulaṃ tenopasaṃkramiṣyāmo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: asya bhadanta bhagavan suvarṇaprabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya imāni evaṃrūpāṇi dṛp dhārmikāṇi māra parājayikāni ca guṇāni saṃpaśyamānasya buddha sahasra avarupta kuśala mūlasya manuṣya rājasya anukampāt ca aparimita puṇya skandha parigraham saṃpaśyamānāḥ te vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahārājāḥ sa bala parivārāḥ anekaiḥ yakṣa śata sahasraiḥ sārdham sva bhavana gatāḥ nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāḥ saṃcoditāḥ samānā
translated: Venerable Blessed One, we see that for a human king who has planted the roots of virtue by serving a thousand Buddhas and who possesses such qualities as these, which are conducive to the defeat of Mara, there is compassion, and we see the acquisition of immeasurable merit. Therefore, Venerable Blessed One, we, the Four Great Kings, together with our armies and retinues, and with many hundreds of thousands of yakshas, while dwelling in our own abodes, will be inspired by canopies of various fragrances and incenses. Having been thus incited, with invisible bodies we will approach the palace of that human king, which is well-swept and well-cleaned, well-sprinkled with various fragrant waters, and well-adorned with various ornaments, in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: brahmā ca sahāṃpatiḥ śakraśca devānāmindraḥ sarasvatī ca mahādevī śrīśca mahādevī dṛḍhā ca pṛthivīdevatā saṃjayaśca mahāyakṣasenāpatiraṣṭāviṃśatimahāyakṣasenāpatayaśca maheśvaraśca devaputro vajrapāṇiśca guhyakādhipatirmāṇibhadraśca mahāyakṣasenāpatirhārītī ca pañcaputraśataparivārā anavataptaśca nāgarājaḥ sāgaraśca nāgarājaḥ /
analyzed: brahmā ca sahāṃpatiḥ śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ sarasvatī ca mahādevī śrīḥ ca mahādevī dṛḍhā ca pṛthivī devatā saṃjayaḥ ca mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ aṣṭāviṃśati mahā yakṣa senāpatayaḥ ca maheśvaraḥ ca deva putraḥ vajrapāṇiḥ ca guhyaka adhipatiḥ māṇibhadraḥ ca mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ hārītī ca pañca putra śata parivārāḥ anavataptaḥ ca nāga rājaḥ sāgaraḥ ca nāga rājaḥ
translated: Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, Śakra, lord of the gods, the great goddess Sarasvatī, the great goddess Śrī, the earth goddess Dṛdhā, the great yakṣa general Saṃjaya, the twenty-eight great yakṣa generals, the god Maheśvara, the lord of guhyakas Vajrapāṇi, the great yakṣa general Maṇibhadra, Hārītī with her retinue of five hundred sons, the nāga kings Anavatapta and Sāgara,

original: anekāni ca devakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyadṛśyairātmabhāvairyena tasya manuṣyarājasya tatra ta nānālaṃkārasamalaṃkṛtaṃ rājakulaṃ yatra tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ puṣpābhikīrṇāyāṃ dharaṇyāṃ śaucapragṛhītaṃ nānālaṃkārasamalaṃkṛtaṃ yatra yatra dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ puṣpābhikīrṇāyaṃ dharaṇyāṃ śaucapragṛhītaṃ nānālaṃkārasamalaṃkṛtaṃ yatra yatra dharmāsanaṃ prajñaptaṃ tatra bhaviṣyanti dharmaśravaṇāya //
analyzed: anekāni ca deva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi adṛśyaiḥ ātmabhāvaiḥ yena tasya manuṣya rājasya tatra nānā alaṃkāra samalaṃkṛtam rājakulam yatra tasya dharma bhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ puṣpa abhikīrṇāyām dharaṇyām śauca pragṛhītam nānā alaṃkāra samalaṃkṛtam yatra yatra dharma bhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ puṣpa abhikīrṇāyam dharaṇyām śauca pragṛhītam nānā alaṃkāra samalaṃkṛtam yatra yatra dharma bhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ puṣpa abhikīrṇā
translated: “Many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods, with invisible bodies, will come to the palace of that human king, where the Dharma teacher bhikṣu is. They will come to the place where the Dharma teacher bhikṣu has arranged a Dharma seat on the ground strewn with flowers, and where they have prepared a pure and well-adorned place. They will come there to listen to the Dharma.”

original: te vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃścatvāro mahārājā anekairyakṣaśatasahasrairebhiśca sarvaiḥ sārdhaṃ samagrā bhaviṣyāmastasya manuṣyarājasya kalyāṇamitrasahāyakasya kalyāṇasaṃprāpakasyānuttaramahārasodāradāturanena dharmāmṛtarasena saṃtarpitāḥ saṃtarpya tasya manuṣyarājasyārakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ anekaiḥ yakṣa śata sahasraiḥ ebhiḥ ca sarvaiḥ sārdham samagrāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ tasya manuṣya rājasya kalyāṇa mitra sahāyakasya kalyāṇa saṃprāpakasya anuttara mahā rasa udāra dātuḥ anena dharma amṛta rasena saṃtarpitāḥ saṃtarpya tasya manuṣya rājasya ārakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: “And many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods will be present in the invisible forms of men in the king’s palace, where the Dharma preacher will be, in the place where the Dharma seat has been prepared, on the ground strewn with flowers, in the clean, well-decorated place. “We will be there, Lord, together with the many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of yakṣas, all of us together, to listen to the Dharma. “We will protect that human king, Lord, who is a friend to virtue, who is a benefactor, who is a giver of the great, unsurpassed, vast enjoyment, who is satisfied with the taste of the nectar of the Dharma, and who has satisfied us.

analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam śānti svastyayanam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will provide protection, support, and guard, and bring about peace and well-being.

original: tasya rājakulasya ca nagarasya ca viṣayasya ca rakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tasya rāja kulasya ca nagarasya ca viṣayasya ca rakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will provide protection, support, and guard, and bring about peace and well-being for that royal family, city, and country.

analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam śānti svastyayanam kariṣyāmam
translated: We will provide protection, support, and guard, and bring about peace and well-being.

analyzed: tat ca viṣayam sarva upadrava upasarga upāyāsebhyaḥ parimocayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: And we will free that country from all calamities, misfortunes, and troubles.

analyzed: yaḥ kaścid bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājaḥ bhavet
translated: Venerable Blessed One, whatever human king there may be,

original: yasya ca manuṣyarājasya viṣaye'yaṃ sūtrendrarājaṃ saṃpracaret /
analyzed: yasya ca manuṣya rājasya viṣaye iyam sūtrā indra rājam saṃpracaret
translated: in whose country this king of sūtras is practiced,

original: yadā cāsau bhadanta bhagavanmanuṣyarājaḥ suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya dhārakān bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā na satkuryānna gurukuryānna mānayenna pūjayet /
analyzed: yadā ca asau bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājaḥ suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya dhārakān bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ na satkuryāt na gurukuryāt na mānayet na pūjayet
translated: and when, Venerable Blessed One, that human king does not honor, respect, esteem, and worship the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās who uphold the king of sūtras, the excellent Suvarṇa-prabhāsa,

original: asmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāmanekāni yakṣakoṭīniyutaśatasahassrāṇyanena dharmaśravaṇenainena dharmāmṛtarasena na saṃtarpayeranna pratimānayeran
analyzed: asmākam caturṇām mahārājānām anekāni yakṣa koṭī niyuta śata sahassrāṇi anena dharma śravaṇena enena dharma amṛta rasena na saṃtarpayeran na pratimānayeran
translated: then he does not satisfy and honor the many koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of yakṣas belonging to us four great kings with this Dharma discourse and the nectar-like taste of the Dharma.

original: imāni divyātmabhāvāni mahatā tejasā na vivardhayenna cāsmākaṃ vīryaṃ ca balaṃ ca saṃjanayet /
analyzed: imāni divya ātmabhāvāni mahatā tejasā na vivardhayet na ca asmākam vīryam ca balam ca saṃjanayet
translated: They will not increase the divine bodies with great splendor, nor will they generate our vigor and strength.

original: tejaśca śriyaśca lakṣmīṃ cāsmākaṃ kāyeṣu na vivardhayet /
analyzed: tejaḥ ca śriyaḥ ca lakṣmīm ca asmākam kāyeṣu na vivardhayet
translated: They will not increase our splendor, glory, and prosperity.

original: na te'pi vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃścatvāro mahārājāḥ sabalaparivārā anekairyakṣakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraistasya ca viṣaye rakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: na te api vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ sa bala parivārāḥ anekaiḥ yakṣa koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ tasya ca viṣaye rakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We, Venerable Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, together with our armies and retinues, and many hundreds of thousands of millions of yakshas, will provide protection for that realm.

analyzed: bhadanta bhagavan viṣayam asmākam upekṣantaḥ sarva viṣaya vāsinaḥ deva gaṇāḥ tam viṣayam upekṣyanti
translated: Venerable Blessed One, the hosts of gods who dwell in all realms will neglect that realm.

analyzed: devatāḥ ca bhadanta bhagavantam viṣayam upekṣyante
translated: The gods, Venerable Blessed One, will neglect that realm.

original: tatra tatra viṣaye nānāvidhā viṣayalopā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tatra tatra viṣaye nānāvidhāḥ viṣaya lopāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: In that realm, various kinds of losses will occur.

original: dāruṇāni ca rājasaṃkṣobhāni bhaviṣyanti /🔽sarvaviṣayagatāni ca sattvāni kalahajātāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: dāruṇāni ca rāja saṃkṣobhāni bhaviṣyanti  sarva viṣaya gatāni ca sattvāni kalaha jātāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: There will be terrible political disturbances.

original: bhaṇḍanajātāni vigṛhītāni vivādamāpannāni nānāvidhāśca graharogā viṣaye prādurbhāviṣyanti /
analyzed: bhaṇḍana jātāni vigṛhītāni vivādam āpannāni nānāvidhāḥ ca graha rogāḥ viṣaye prādurbhāviṣyanti
translated: The beings in all realms will be engaged in quarrels, disputes, and arguments. Various kinds of demonic diseases will appear in the realm.

analyzed: nānā digabhyaḥ āgatāḥ ca ulkā pātāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: Meteors will appear, coming from various directions.

analyzed: graha nakṣatrāṇi ca paraspareṇa viruddhāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: The planets and stars will be in opposition to each other.

analyzed: sūrya pratirūpakāṇi śaśinaḥ utpādayiṣyanti
translated: They will produce images resembling the sun on the moon.

analyzed: candra grahāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: There will be lunar eclipses.

original: sūryagrahāśca satatasamitaṃ gaganāntaragatau sūryacandramasau no dṛkyathagatau bhaviṣyataḥ /
analyzed: sūrya grahāḥ ca satata samitam gagana antara gatau sūrya candramasau naḥ bhaviṣyataḥ
translated: The sun and moon, always moving in the sky, will not be seen as they should be.

original: ulkāpātasadṛśavarṇāni pariveśakāni gaganāntare kālena kālaṃ prādurbhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ulkā pāta sadṛśa varṇāni pariveśakāni gagana antare kālena kālam prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: Colored halos resembling meteors will appear from time to time in the sky.

analyzed: pṛthivī kampāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: There will be earthquakes.

analyzed: kūpāḥ ca pṛthivī gatāḥ saṃkṣepantaḥ śokṣyanti  viṣama vātāḥ ca vāsyanti
translated: Wells dug in the ground will dry up.🔽Unfavorable winds will blow.

analyzed: viṣama varṣāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: There will be unfavorable rains.

analyzed: durbhikṣa kāntāraḥ ca sarva viṣaye bhaviṣyati
translated: There will be a famine and a wilderness in the entire country.

analyzed: para cakrāṇi ca tad viṣayam vekṣyanti
translated: Enemy armies will invade that country.

analyzed: āyāsa bahulam bhaviṣyati
translated: There will be much hardship.

original: teṣāmasmākaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃścaturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sabalaparivārāṇāmanekeṣāṃ ca yakṣaśatasahasrāṇāṃ viṣayavāsināṃ ca devanāgānāṃ taṃ viṣayamupekṣatastatra viṣaya imānyevaṃ rūpāṇi nānāvidhānyupadravaśatāni bhaviṣyantyupadrasahasrāṇi vā //
analyzed: teṣām asmākam bhadanta bhagavan caturṇām mahārājānām sa bala parivārāṇām anekeṣām ca yakṣa śata sahasrāṇām viṣaya vāsinām ca deva nāgānām tam viṣayam upekṣataḥ tatra viṣaye imāni evam rūpāṇi nānāvidhāni upadrava śatāni bhaviṣyanti upadra sahasrāṇi vā
translated: Reverend Lord, if we, the four great kings, together with our retinues and the many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas dwelling in our realms, were to neglect that realm, then in that realm there would occur various calamities of this kind, or calamities of other kinds, in the hundreds and thousands.

analyzed: yam kaścid bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājaḥ bhavet
translated: Reverend Lord, whatever human king there may be who...
