original: tadgṛhaṃ sa caukṣaṃ kṛtvā vihāraṃ cāraṇyāyatanaṃ vāṃ gomayena maṇḍalakaṃ kṛtvā gandhapuṣpadhūpaṃ ca dātavyam /
analyzed: tat gṛham sa caukṣam kṛtvā vihāram ca araṇya āyatanam vām gomayena maṇḍalakam kṛtvā gandha puṣpa dhūpam ca dātavyam
translated: Having made that house, monastery, or forest dwelling clean, having made a mandala with cow dung, incense, flowers, and perfume should be offered.

analyzed: caukṣam āsanam prajñapayitavyam
translated: A clean seat should be arranged.

analyzed: puṣpāḥ avakīrṇantu mitavyam
translated: Flowers should be scattered.

analyzed: tatas tad kṣaṇam śrīḥ mahādevī praviśitvā tatra sthāsyati
translated: Then at that very moment, the great goddess Shri will enter there and remain.

original: tadupādāya tatra gṛhe vā grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā vihāre vāraṇyāyatane vā na jātu kenacidvaikalpaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: tat upādāya tatra gṛhe vā grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā vihāre vā araṇi āyatane vā na jātu kenacid vaikalpam kariṣyati
translated: From that time onwards, in that house, village, town, market, monastery, or forest dwelling, no one will ever experience any misfortune.

original: hiraṇyena vā suvarṇena vā ratnena vā dhanena vā dhānyādisarvopakaraṇasamṛddhābhioḥ sarvasukhopadhānena sukhitāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: hiraṇyena vā suvarṇena vā ratnena vā dhanena vā dhānya ādi sarva upakaraṇa samṛddhābhiḥ sarva sukha upadhānena sukhitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be prosperous with gold, silver, jewels, wealth, grain, and all necessary provisions, and will be happy with all the comforts of life.

analyzed: kuśala mūlaḥ ca dhriyate
translated: And the root of virtue will be upheld.

original: tena sarvaṃ śriyo mahādevyāḥ premaprabhāvapreṣaṇaṃ dātavyaṃ yāvajjīvaṃ tatropasthāsyati na vilambiṣyati /
analyzed: tena sarvam śriyaḥ mahādevyāḥ prema prabhāva preṣaṇam dātavyam yāvajjīvam tatra upasthāsyati na vilambiṣyati
translated: Therefore, all the love, power, and gifts of the great goddess Shri should be given, and she will serve there for as long as one lives, without delay.

analyzed: sarva abhiprāyān ca eṣām paripūrayiṣyati iti
translated: And she will fulfill all their aspirations.

analyzed: iti śrī suvarṇaprabhāsottama sūtra indrarāje śrī mahādevīparivartaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter named The Great Goddess in the glorious king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa-uttamarāja.

analyzed: nāma navamaḥ
translated: Chapter 9.

analyzed: sarva buddha bodhisattva nāmasaṃdhāraṇi parivartaḥ  om namaḥ bhagavate ratnaśikhinaḥ tathāgatasya
translated: The Chapter on the Dhāraṇī of the Names of All Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.🔽Om. Homage to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Ratnaśikhin.

analyzed: namaḥ suvarṇa ratna ākara chatraskūṭasya tathāgatasya
translated: Homage to the Tathāgata Suvarṇaratnākara-chatra-skūṭa.

analyzed: namaḥ suvarṇa puṣpa jvala raśmi ketoḥ tathāgatasya
translated: Homage to the Tathagata Suvarnapushpa-jvalarasmi-ketu.

analyzed: namaḥ mahāpradīpasya tathāgatasya
translated: Homage to the Tathagata Mahapradipta.

analyzed: ruciraketuḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ  suvarṇaprabhāsottamaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva named Ruciraketu.🔽The Bodhisattva named Suvarna-prabhasa-uttama.

analyzed: suvarṇagandhaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva named Suvarna-gandha.

analyzed: sadāpraruditaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva named Sadaprarudita.

analyzed: dharmodgataḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva named Dharmodgata.

analyzed: tathāgataḥ
translated: In the east is the Tathagata named Akshobhya.

analyzed: dakṣiṇena ratnaketuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the south is the Tathagata named Ratnaketu.

analyzed: paścimena amitāyuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the west is the Tathagata named Amitayus.

analyzed: uttare dundubhisvaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the north is the Tathagata named Dundubhisvara.

original: suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarāja imāni bodhisattvanāmāni ye dhārayanti vācayanti te bodhisattvā nityaṃ jātismarā bhontīti //
analyzed: suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rāje imāni bodhisattva nāmāni ye dhārayanti vācayanti te bodhisattvāḥ nityam jātismarāḥ bhonti iti
translated: In the Suvarna-prabhasa-uttama Sutra Indra Raja, these are the names of the Bodhisattvas. Those who uphold and recite them, those Bodhisattvas will always remember their past lives.

analyzed: iti śrī suparṇaprabhāsottama sūtra indrarāje sarva buddha bodhisattva nāma
translated: Thus in the Suvarna-prabhasa-uttama Sutra Indra Raja, the names of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas

analyzed: saṃdhāraṇioparivartaḥ nāma daśamaḥ
translated: The tenth chapter is named the chapter on the retention of the sutra.

analyzed: dṛḍhā pṛthivī devatā parivartaḥ
translated: The chapter on the earth goddess Dṛḍhā.

analyzed: atha khalu dṛḍhā pṛthivī devatā bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the earth goddess Dṛḍhā said this to the Blessed One:

original: ayaṃ bhadanta bhagavansuvarṇaprabhāsottamaḥ sūtrendrarāja etarhi cānāgate'dhvani yatra grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vāraṇyapradeśe vā girikandare vā rājakule vopasaṃkramiṣyati /
analyzed: ayam bhadanta bhagavan suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sūtra indra rājaḥ etarhi ca anāgata idhvani yatra grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vā araṇya pradeśe vā giri kandare vā rājakule vā upasaṃkramiṣyati
translated: Venerable Blessed One, this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, whether it enters a village, town, city, country, forest region, mountain cave, or royal palace,

analyzed: yatra ayam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sūtra indra rājaḥ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati
translated: wherever this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, will be extensively taught,

original: yatra yatra bhagavanpṛthivīpradeśe tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣo ṛjukāyagatasya dharmāsanaprajñaptaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yatra yatra bhagavan pṛthivī pradeśe tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣo ṛju kāya gatasya dharma āsana prajñaptam bhaviṣyati
translated: in whatever place, Blessed One, that Dharma preacher monk will sit upright and arrange the Dharma seat,

original: yatra yatrāsane dharmabhāṇako niṣadyemaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaṃ sūtrendrarājaṃ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati /
analyzed: yatra yatra āsane dharmabhāṇakaḥ niṣadya imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rājam vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati
translated: in whatever seat the Dharma preacher, sitting, will extensively teach this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa,

original: tatrāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavandṛḍhā pṛthivīdevatā teṣu pṛthivīpradeśeṣvāgamiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tatra aham bhadanta bhagavan dṛḍhā pṛthivī devatā teṣu pṛthivī pradeśeṣu āgamiṣyāmi
translated: there, Blessed One, I, the earth goddess Dṛḍhā, will come to those places on earth.

original: atra dharmāsanagato'smyadṛśyamānenātmabhāvenottamāṅgena ca tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ pādatalau pratisaṃhariṣyāmi /
analyzed: atra dharma āsana gataḥ asmi adṛśyamānena ātma bhāvena uttamāṅgena ca tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ pāda talau pratisaṃhariṣyāmi
translated: Here, seated on the Dharma seat, with my invisible body and head, I will touch the soles of the feet of that Dharma-expounding monk.

analyzed: ātmānam ca anena dharma śravaṇena dharma amṛta rasena saṃtarpayiṣyāmi
translated: And I will satisfy myself with this Dharma discourse, with the nectar-like taste of the Dharma.

analyzed: saṃpratimānayiṣyāmi saṃpūjayiṣyāmi
translated: I will honor it, I will revere it.

original: ātmānaṃ ca saṃtarpayitvā pratimānayitvā saṃpraharṣayitvemamaṣṭaṣaṣṭiyojanasahasrāṇi pṛthivīskandhamātmānaṃ cānena dharmaśravaṇena dharmāmṛtarasena yāvadvajramayaṃ pṛthivītalamupādāya pṛthivīrasenavivardhayiṣyāmi saṃpratimānayiṣyāmi paripūrayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: ātmānam ca saṃtarpayitvā pratimānayitvā saṃpraharṣayitvā imam aṣṭaṣaṣṭi yojana sahasrāṇi pṛthivī skandham ātmānam ca anena dharma śravaṇena dharma amṛta rasena yāvat vajra mayam pṛthivī talam upādāya pṛthivī rasena vivardhayiṣyāmi saṃpratimānayiṣyāmi paripūrayiṣyāmi
translated: Having satisfied myself, having honored it, having delighted myself, I will, starting from the diamond base, with this Dharma discourse, with the nectar-like taste of the Dharma, increase the sap of the earth up to the eighty-four thousand yojanas of the earth's surface, and I will honor it, I will fulfill it.

original: uparitaścemaṃ samudraparyantaṃ pṛthivītalamupādāya pṛthivīmaṇḍalaṃ snigdhena pṛthivīrasena snehayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: uparitas ca imam samudra paryantam pṛthivī talam upādāya pṛthivī maṇḍalam snigdhena pṛthivī rasena snehayiṣyāmi
translated: And above, starting from the ocean's edge, I will moisten the earth's surface with the moist sap of the earth.

analyzed: ojasvitarām ca imām mahā pṛthivīm kariṣyāmi
translated: And I will make this great earth more vital.

analyzed: yena asmin jambudvīpe nānā tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ ojasvitarāḥ prarohayiṣyanti
translated: So that in this Jambudvīpa, various grasses, shrubs, herbs, and trees will grow more vital.

analyzed: sarva ārāmana vṛkṣa sasyāni ca nānāvidhāni ojasvitarāṇi bhaviṣyanti
translated: All the trees, crops, and plants in the pleasure groves will be more vigorous,

original: gandhatarāṇi snigdhatarāṇyāsvadanīyāni darśanīyatarāṇi mahottarāṇi ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: gandhatarāṇi snigdhatarāṇi āsvadanīyāni darśanīyatarāṇi mahā uttarāṇi ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: more fragrant, more smooth, more delicious, more beautiful, and more abundant.

original: te ca sattvāstāni pānabhojanāni nānāvidhānyupabhuktvā āyurbalavarṇendriyāṇi vivardhayiṣyanti /
analyzed: te ca sattvāḥ tāni pāna bhojanāni nānāvidhāni upabhuktvā āyuḥ bala varṇa indriyāṇi vivardhayiṣyanti
translated: And those beings, having enjoyed those various kinds of food and drink, will increase their lifespan, strength, complexion, and faculties.

original: tejobalavarṇarūpasamanvāuatāśca bhūtvā nānāvidhāni pṛthivīgatānyanekāni nānākāryaśatasahasrāṇi kariṣyantyutthāsyanti vyāpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: tejaḥ bala varṇa rūpa samanvāuatāḥ ca bhūtvā nānāvidhāni pṛthivī gatāni anekāni nānā kārya śata sahasrāṇi kariṣyanti utthāsyanti vyāpayiṣyanti
translated: Having become endowed with splendor, strength, complexion, and form, they will perform various kinds of work on the earth, many hundreds of thousands of different tasks, they will rise up and spread out.

analyzed: bala karaṇīyāni karmāṇi kariṣyanti
translated: They will perform actions that require strength.

original: tena hetunā bhadanta bhagavansarvajambudvīpaḥ kṣemaśca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena hetunā bhadanta bhagavan sarva jambudvīpaḥ kṣemaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: For that reason, Venerable Blessed One, all Jambudvīpa will be secure,

analyzed: subhikṣaḥ ca sphītaḥ ca ṛddhaḥ ca ramaṇīyaḥ ca bahu jana ākīrṇa manuṣyaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: abundant, prosperous, flourishing, delightful, and full of many people.

analyzed: sarva jambudvīpe ca sattvāni sukhitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: And all the beings in Jambudvīpa will be happy.

analyzed: nānā vicitrām ratim anubhaviṣyanti
translated: They will experience various kinds of delightful things.

analyzed: tāni sattvāni tejaḥ bala varṇa rūpa samanvāgatāni ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those beings will be endowed with the splendor, strength, complexion, and form.

original: asya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasyārthāya teṣāṃ sūtrendradhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānaṃ dharmāsanagatānāmantikamupasaṃkrameyuḥ
analyzed: asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya arthāya teṣām sūtra indra dhārakāṇām bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānam dharma āsana gatānām antikam upasaṃkrameyuḥ
translated: For the sake of this excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, they will approach the Dharma seats of those bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās who uphold this excellent sūtra.

original: upasaṃkramitvā tāni prasannacittāni sarvasattvānāmarthāya hitāya sukhāya tāndharmabhāṇakānadhyeṣayeyusya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya prakāśataḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramitvā tāni prasanna cittāni sarva sattvānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya tān dharma bhāṇakān adhyeṣayeyuḥ sya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya prakāśataḥ
translated: Having approached, with pure minds for the sake, benefit, and happiness of all beings, they will request those Dharma teachers to expound the excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa.

original: ahaṃ dṛḍhā pṛthivīdevatā saparivāraujasvitarā ca bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham dṛḍhā pṛthivī devatā sa parivārā ojasvitarā ca bhaviṣyāmi
translated: I, the firm earth goddess, together with my retinue, will become even more powerful.

original: tena bhadanta bhagavaṃścāsmākaṃ kāye mahābalavī ryasthāmasaṃjanitaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena bhadanta bhagavan ca asmākam kāye mahā bala vī rya sthāma saṃjanitam bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, Venerable Blessed One, great strength, vigor, and power will be generated in our bodies.

analyzed: tejaḥ ca śrīḥ ca lakṣmīḥ ca asmākam kāyam āvekṣyanti
translated: Splendor, glory, and grace will look upon our bodies.

original: mayi ca bhadanta bhagavandṛḍhāyāṃ pṛthivīdevatāyāmanena dharmāmṛtarasena saṃtarpitāyāṃ mahātejobalavīryasthāmavegapratilabdhāyāmiyaṃ mahāpṛthivī saptayojanasāhasrikāyaṃ jambudvīpo mahatā pṛthivīrasena vivardhayiṣyati /
analyzed: mayi ca bhadanta bhagavan dṛḍhāyām pṛthivī devatāyām anena dharma amṛta rasena saṃtarpitāyām mahā tejaḥ bala vīrya sthāma vega pratilabdhāyām iyam mahā pṛthivī sapta yojana sāhasrikā ayam jambudvīpaḥ mahatā pṛthivī rasena vivardhayiṣyati
translated: And, Venerable Blessed One, when I, the earth goddess Dṛḍhā, am satisfied with this nectar-like taste of the Dharma, and have attained great splendor, strength, energy, power, and impetus, this great earth will increase this Jambudvīpa by seven thousand yojanas with great earth essence.

analyzed: ojasvitarā ca mahā pṛthivī bhaviṣyati
translated: And the great earth will become more vital.

original: imāni ca bhadanta bhagana sarvasattvāni pṛthivīsaṃniśritāni vṛddhivirūḍhivaipulyatāṃ ca gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: imāni ca bhadanta bhagana sarva sattvāni pṛthivī saṃniśritāni vṛddhi virūḍhi vaipulya tām ca gamiṣyanti
translated: And, Venerable Blessed One, all these beings who depend on the earth will grow, flourish, and become abundant.

analyzed: mahanti ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will become great.

original: mahanti ca bhūtvā sarvasattvāni pṛthivīgatāni nānopabhogaparibhogānyupabhokṣyanti sukhāni cānubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: mahanti ca bhūtvā sarva sattvāni pṛthivī gatāni nānā upabhoga paribhogāni upabhokṣyanti sukhāni ca anubhaviṣyanti
translated: And having become great, all beings on the earth will enjoy various pleasures and experiences, and will experience happiness.

original: tāni ca sarvāṇi nānāvicitrānnapānabhojyavastraśayanāsanavasanabhavanavimānodyānanadīpuṣkariṇyutsarohradataḍāgādīnīmānyevaṃrūpāṇi nānāvidhānyupakaraṇasukhāni pṛthivīsaṃsthitāni pṛthivyāṃ prādurbhūtāni pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhitānyupabhujantu /
analyzed: tāni ca sarvāṇi nānā vicitra anna pāna bhojya vastra śayana āsana vasana bhavana vimāna udyāna nadī puṣkariṇī utsaraḥ hrada taḍāga ādīni imāni evaṃrūpāṇi nānāvidhāni upakaraṇa sukhāni pṛthivī saṃsthitāni pṛthivyām prādurbhūtāni pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhitāni upabhujantu
translated: And may all those various kinds of comfortable requisites, such as food, drink, solid food, clothes, bedding, seats, dwellings, palaces, gardens, rivers, lotus ponds, lakes, ponds, and so on, which are on the earth, which have appeared on the earth, which are established on the earth, be enjoyed.

original: tena bhadanta bhagavanhetunā sarvasattvairasmākaṃ kṛtajñatā kartavyā /
analyzed: tena bhadanta bhagavan hetunā sarva sattvaiḥ asmākam kṛtajña tā kartavyā
translated: Therefore, Venerable Blessed One, all beings should be grateful to us.

original: avaśyamayaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaḥ sūtrendrarājaḥ satkṛtya śrotavyaḥ satkartavyo gurukartavyo mānayitavyaḥ pūjayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: avaśyam ayam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sūtra indra rājaḥ satkṛtya śrotavyaḥ satkartavyaḥ gurukartavyaḥ mānayitavyaḥ pūjayitavyaḥ
translated: This excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra-Indra called Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, should definitely be listened to with respect, it should be respected, revered, honored, and worshipped.

original: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavaṃste sarve sattvā nānākulebhyo nānāgṛhebhyo niṣkrameyusteṣāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāmupasakramaṇāya /
analyzed: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan te sarve sattvāḥ nānā kulebhyaḥ nānā gṛhebhyaḥ niṣkrameyuḥ teṣām dharma bhāṇakānām upasakramaṇāya
translated: And when, Venerable Blessed One, all those beings would come out from various families and various houses to approach those Dharma teachers,

analyzed: upasaṃkramya ca imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rājam śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: and having approached, they would listen to this excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra-Indra called Suvarṇa-prabhāsa,

original: śrutvā ca punareva te sattvāḥ svakasvakeṣu nānākuleṣu gṛhagrāmanagaranigameṣu praviṣṭāḥ svagṛhagatāṃ paraspareṇaivaṃ kathayeyuḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar eva te sattvāḥ svaka svakeṣu nānā kuleṣu gṛha grāma nagara nigameṣu praviṣṭāḥ sva gṛha gatām paraspareṇa evam kathayeyuḥ
translated: And having heard it, those beings, having entered their various families, houses, villages, towns, and cities, having gone to their own homes, would say to each other:

analyzed: gambhīraḥ smābhiḥ adya dharma śravaṇaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: Today we have heard a profound Dharma teaching.

analyzed: acintyaḥ smābhiḥ adya puṇya skandhaḥ parigṛhītaḥ
translated: Today we have taken up an inconceivable heap of merit.

analyzed: tena dharma śravaṇena narakāḥ pratimuktāḥ syuḥ
translated: By that Dharma teaching, we have been freed from the hells.

analyzed: tiryagyoni yama loka preta viṣayāḥ parimuktāḥ adya asmābhiḥ
translated: We have been liberated from the realms of animals, ghosts, and the Asura world.

analyzed: anena dharma śravanena anāgata idhvani anekeṣu jāti śata sahasreṣu deva manuṣya upapatti parigṛhītāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: By this Dharma teaching, in many hundreds of thousands of future lives, we will be reborn as gods and humans.

original: tena ca nānāgṛhagatā bhūtvā teṣāṃ sattvānāmitaḥ suvarṇaprabhāsottamātsūtrendrarājādantaśa ekadṛṣṭāntamapyārocayeyurantaśa ekaparivartaṃ vā ekapūrvayogaṃ vāntaśaścatuṣpādikāmapi gāthāmantaśa ekapadamapi suvarṇaprabhāsottamātsūtrendrarājādanyeṣāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃśrāvayeyurantaśaḥ suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya nāmadheyamapi pareṣāṃ sattvānā saṃśrāvayeyuḥ /
analyzed: tena ca nānā gṛha gatāḥ bhūtvā teṣām sattvānām itas suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamāt sūtra indrarājāt antaśas eka dṛṣṭāntam api ārocayeyuḥ antaśas eka parivartam vā eka pūrva yogam vā antaśas catuṣpādikām api gāthām antaśas eka padam api suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamāt sūtra indrarājāt anyeṣām sattvānām saṃśrāvayeyuḥ antaśas suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indrarājasya nāmadheyam api pareṣām sattvānām saṃśrāvayeyuḥ
translated: And having gone to various homes, they would explain to those beings at least one parable from this excellent Suvarṇa-prabhāsa-sūtra-indrarāja, or at least one chapter, or one former existence, or at least a four-line verse, or at least one word from the excellent Suvarṇa-prabhāsa-sūtra-indrarāja, and would make it heard by other beings, or at least they would make the name of the excellent Suvarṇa-prabhāsa-sūtra-indrarāja heard by other beings.

original: yatra yatra bhadanta bhagavaṃstāni nānāvidhāni sattvāni nānāvidheṣu pṛthivīpradeśaṣvimānyevaṃrūpāṇi nānāvidhāni sūtrāntahetūni paraspareṇārocayeyuḥ saṃśrāvayeyuśca /
analyzed: yatra yatra bhadanta bhagavan tāni nānāvidhāni sattvāni nānāvidheṣu pṛthivī pradeśaṣu imāni evaṃrūpāṇi nānāvidhāni sūtrānta hetūni paraspareṇa ārocayeyuḥ saṃśrāvayeyuḥ ca
translated: Wherever, Venerable Blessed One, those various beings in various regions of the earth would explain to each other these various causes of sūtras of this kind, and would make them heard,

analyzed: kathā saṃbandham ca kurvīran
translated: and would make a connection with the story,

original: sarve te bhadanta bhagavanpṛthivīpradeśā ojasvitarāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve te bhadanta bhagavan pṛthivī pradeśāḥ ojasvitarāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: all those regions of the earth, Venerable Blessed One, will become more vigorous,

analyzed: snigdhatarāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: and will become more gentle.

original: sarveṣāṃ sattvānāṃ teṣu teṣu pṛthivīpradeśeṣu nānāvidhāni pṛthivīrasāni sarvopakaraṇāni bhūyiṣṭhataramutpatsyante vivardhayiṣyante vaipulyatāṃ gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarveṣām sattvānām teṣu teṣu pṛthivī pradeśeṣu nānāvidhāni pṛthivī rasāni sarva upakaraṇāni bhūyiṣṭhataram utpatsyante vivardhayiṣyante vaipulya tām gamiṣyanti
translated: In all those regions of the earth, various kinds of earth essences and all kinds of implements will be produced in abundance, will increase, and will become plentiful.

original: sarvāṇi tāni sattvāni mahādhanāni mahābhogāni ca dānādhimuktāni ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarvāṇi tāni sattvāni mahādhanāni mahā bhogāni ca dāna adhimuktāni ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: All those beings will be greatly wealthy, greatly prosperous, and devoted to generosity.

analyzed: triṣu ratneṣu abhiprasannāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have deep faith in the Three Jewels.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavan dṛḍhām pṛthivī devatām etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the earth goddess Dṛdhā:

original: ye kecitpṛthivīdevate sattvā itaḥ suvarṇaprabhāsottamātsūtrendrarājādantaśa ekapadamapi śṛṇuyuste ta ito manuṣyalokāccavitvā trayastriṃśatsu devanikāyeṣvanyatarānyatareṣu devanikāyeṣūpapatsyante /
analyzed: ye kecid pṛthivī devate sattvāḥ itas suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamāt sūtra indrarājāt antaśas eka padam api śṛṇuyuḥ te te itas manuṣya lokāt ca vitvā trayastriṃśatsu deva nikāyeṣu anyatara anyatareṣu deva nikāyeṣu upapatsyante
translated: Earth goddess, whatever beings hear even a single word from this excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, they, having died from this human world, will be reborn in one or another of the thirty-three groups of gods.

original: ye kecitpṛthivī devate sattvā asya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājāsyārthāya tāni sthānāni samalaṃkurvīrannantaśa ekacchatraṃ vā ekadūṣyaṃ vā samalaṃkṛtāni ca devatāsthānāni /
analyzed: ye kecid pṛthivī devate sattvāḥ asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rāja asya arthāya tāni sthānāni samalaṃkurvīran antaśas eka chatram vā eka dūṣyam vā samalaṃkṛtāni ca devatāsthānāni
translated: O gods of the earth, whatever beings there are who will adorn those places for the sake of this excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, even if it is only one parasol or one piece of cloth, and the places of the gods are well adorned,

original: teṣu saptasu kāmāvacareṣu devanikāyeṣu saptaratnamayāni divyāni vimānāni sarvālaṃkārasamalaṃkṛtāni saṃsthāsyanti te sattvā ito manuṣyalokāccyāvitvā teṣu saptaratnamayeṣu divyavimāneṣūpapatsyante /
analyzed: teṣu saptasu kāmāvacareṣu devanikāyeṣu sapta ratna mayāni divyāni vimānāni sarva alaṃkāra samalaṃkṛtāni saṃsthāsyanti te sattvāḥ itas manuṣya lokāt cyāvitvā teṣu sapta ratna mayeṣu divya vimāneṣu upapatsyante
translated: in those seven classes of gods in the desire realm, divine palaces made of the seven precious substances, adorned with all ornaments, will be established. Those beings, having departed from this human world, will be reborn in those divine palaces made of the seven precious substances.

original: te caikaikasminpṛthivīdevate saptaratnamaye divyavimāne saptavarā anupapatsyante acintyāni divyāni sukhāni pratyanubhaviṣyanti //
analyzed: te ca ekaikasmin pṛthivī devate sapta ratna maye divya vimāne sapta varāḥ anupapatsyante acintyāni divyāni sukhāni pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: And in each of those divine palaces made of the seven precious substances, O goddess of the earth, seven boons will be granted, and they will experience inconceivable divine happiness.

analyzed: evam ukte dṛḍhā pṛthivī devatā bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the earth goddess Dṛḍhā said this to the Blessed One:

original: tenāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavandṛḍhā pṛthivīdevatā tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣordharmāsanagatasya teṣu pṛthivīpradeśeṣvavāsiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tena aham bhadanta bhagavan dṛḍhā pṛthivī devatā tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ dharma āsana gatasya teṣu pṛthivī pradeśeṣu avāsiṣyāmi
translated: Therefore, O Blessed One, I, the earth goddess Dṛḍhā, will dwell in those places of the earth where the monk Dharma preacher, seated in the Dharma seat, will teach this excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa.

original: adṛśyamānenātmabhāvena tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoruttamāṅgena pādatalau pratisaṃhariṣyāmi /
analyzed: adṛśyamānena ātmabhāvena tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ uttamāṅgena pāda talau pratisaṃhariṣyāmi
translated: With my invisible body, I will support the feet of that Dharma preacher monk with the crown of my head.

original: yathāpyayaṃ suvarṇaprabhasottamaḥ sūtrendrarājasteṣāṃ buddhasahasrāvaruptakuśalamūlānāṃ sattvānāmarthāya ciraṃ jambudvīpe pracaret /
analyzed: yathā api ayam suvarṇaprabhasa uttamaḥ sūtra indra rājaḥ teṣām buddha sahasra avarupta kuśala mūlānām sattvānām arthāya ciram jambudvīpe pracaret
translated: So that this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, may continue to circulate in Jambudvīpa for a long time for the sake of those beings who have planted the roots of virtue with a thousand Buddhas.

analyzed: na ca kṣipram antardhāpayet
translated: And may it not quickly disappear.

analyzed: sattvāni ca imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rājam śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: And may beings listen to this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa.

analyzed: anāgata udhvani anekāni kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi acintyāni divya mānuṣyakāni sukhāni anubhaveyuḥ
translated: In the future, for many hundreds of thousands of millions of eons, they will experience inconceivable divine and human happiness.

analyzed: tathāgata samavadhāna gatāni ca bhaveyuḥ
translated: And may they come to meet the Tathāgata.

analyzed: anāgata idhvani anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyuḥ
translated: And in the future, may they attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: sarva naraka tiryagyoni yama loka duḥkhāni ca atyanta samucchinnāni bhaveyuḥ iti  iti śrī suvarṇaprabhāsa uttasūtra indrarāje dṛḍhā pṛthivī
translated: And may all the sufferings of the hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama be completely eradicated.

analyzed: devatāparivartaḥ nāma ekādaśaḥ
translated: Thus concludes the eleventh chapter, on the Earth Goddess Dṛḍhā, in the excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa.

analyzed: saṃjñeya mahā yakṣa senāpati parivartaḥ
translated: Chapter on the Great Yaksha General Sanjiva.

original: atha khalu saṃjñeyo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiraṣṭāviṃśatibhirmahāyakṣasenāpatibhiḥ sārdhamutthāyāsanādekāṃsaṃ cīvaraṃ prāvṛtya dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat /
analyzed: atha khalu saṃjñeyaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ aṣṭāviṃśatibhiḥ mahā yakṣa senāpatibhiḥ sārdham utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam cīvaram prāvṛtya dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the great yaksha general named Sanjiva, together with twenty-eight great yaksha generals, rose from their seats, draped their upper robes over one shoulder, placed their right knees on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and said this to the Blessed One:

original: ayaṃ bhadanta bhagavansuvarṇaprabhāsottamaḥ sūtrendrarāja etarhi cānagate'dhvani yatra grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vā janapadapradeśe vāraṇyāyatane vā girikandare vā rājakule vā gṛhe vā pracariṣyati /
analyzed: ayam bhadanta bhagavan suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sūtra indra rājaḥ etarhi ca anagata idhvani yatra grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vā janapada pradeśe vā araṇī āyatane vā giri kandare vā rāja kule vā gṛhe vā pracariṣyati
translated: Venerable Blessed One, this supreme king of sutras, the Golden Light, whether in a village, town, city, country, district, forest dwelling, mountain cave, royal palace, or house, in the present or future,

original: tatrāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavansaṃjñeyo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ sārdhamaṣṭāviṃśati bhirmahāyakṣasenāpatibhistatra grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vāraṇye vā girikandare vā rājakule vopasaṃkramiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tatra aham bhadanta bhagavan saṃjñeyaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ sārdham aṣṭāviṃśati bhiḥ mahā yakṣa senāpatibhiḥ tatra grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vā araṇye vā giri kandare vā rājakule vā upasaṃkramiṣyāmi
translated: there, Blessed One, I, the great yaksha general named Sanjiva, together with twenty-eight great yaksha generals, will approach that village, town, city, country, forest, mountain cave, or royal palace.

original: adṛśyamānenātmabhāvena tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣo rakṣāṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: adṛśyamānena ātma bhāvena tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ rakṣām kariṣyāmi
translated: I will protect that Dharma teacher bhikṣu with an invisible body.

original: paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śastraparihāraṃ śāntisvaratyayanaṃ kariṣyami /
analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam daṇḍa parihāram śastra parihāram śānti sva ratyayanam kariṣyami
translated: I will provide protection, refuge, shelter, safety, avoidance of punishment, avoidance of weapons, peace, and well-being.

original: teṣāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ dharmaśravaṇikānāṃ strīpuruṣadārakadārikāṇāṃ yeṣāṃ keṣāṃciditaḥ suvarṇaprabhāsottamātsūtrendrarājādantaśa ekā catuṣpādikāpi gāthā śrutā bhavedantaśa ekapadamapi suvarṇaprabhāsottamātsūtrendrarājādekabodhisattvanāmadheyamapi śrutaṃ bhavedudgṛhītaṃ vaikatathāgatanāmadheyaṃ vāntaśaścāsya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya nāmadheyaṃ śrutaṃ bhavedudgṛhītaṃ vā teṣāṃ sarveṣāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: teṣām ca sarveṣām dharmaśravaṇikānām strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāṇām yeṣām keṣāṃcid itas suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamāt sūtra indrarājāt antaśas ekā catuṣpādikā api gāthā śrutā bhavet antaśas eka padam api suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamāt sūtra indrarājāt eka bodhisattva nāmadheyam api śrutam bhavet udgṛhītam vā eka tathāgata nāmadheyam vā antaśas ca asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indrarājasya nāmadheyam śrutam bhavet udgṛhītam vā teṣām sar
translated: And for all those who listen to the Dharma, whether men, women, boys, or girls, for whomever hears even a single four-line verse from this excellent Sūtra King of Golden Light, or even a single word, or hears the name of a single bodhisattva from this excellent Sūtra King of Golden Light, or remembers the name of a single Tathāgata, or even hears the name of this excellent Sūtra King of Golden Light and remembers it, I will provide protection for all of them.

original: paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śastraparihāraṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ ca kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam daṇḍa parihāram śastra parihāram śānti svastyayanam ca kariṣyāmi
translated: I will provide protection, refuge, shelter, safety, avoidance of punishment, avoidance of weapons, peace, and well-being.

original: teṣāṃ ca kulānāṃ teṣāṃ ca gṛhāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca nagarāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca grāmāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca nigamānāṃ teṣāṃ cāraṇyānāṃ teṣāṃ ca rājakulānāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyāmi
analyzed: teṣām ca kulānām teṣām ca gṛhāṇām teṣām ca nagarāṇām teṣām ca grāmāṇām teṣām ca nigamānām teṣām ca araṇyānām teṣām ca rāja kulānām ārakṣām kariṣyāmi
translated: I will provide protection for those families, those houses, those cities, those villages, those market towns, those forests, and those royal courts.

original: paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śastraparihāraṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kariṣyāmi //
analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam daṇḍa parihāram śastra parihāram śānti svastyayanam kariṣyāmi
translated: I will provide rescue, protection, defense, the removal of punishment, the removal of weapons, peace, and well-being.

analyzed: tat katamena hetunā
translated: For what reason is that?

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ parijñātāḥ sarva dharmāḥ avabuddhāḥ
translated: All phenomena are fully known, all phenomena are understood.

analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca sarva dharmāḥ  yathā ca sarva dharmāḥ
translated: As many as all phenomena are,🔽and as all phenomena are,

analyzed: saṃsthitāḥ ye ca sarva dharmāḥ
translated: and how all phenomena are,

analyzed: samyak jñātāḥ ca sarva dharmāḥ
translated: and all phenomena are correctly known.

analyzed: sarva dharmeṣu aham bhadanta bhagavan pratyakṣaḥ
translated: Venerable Blessed One, I am directly perceiving in all phenomena.

original: acintyā me bhadanta bhagavañjñānāvabhāsāḥ /🔽acintyo jñānālokaḥ /🔽acintyo jñānapracāraḥ /
analyzed: acintyāḥ me bhadanta bhagavan jñāna avabhāsāḥ  acintyaḥ jñāna ālokaḥ  acintyaḥ jñāna pracāraḥ
translated: Venerable Blessed One, my illuminations of knowledge are inconceivable.🔽The light of knowledge is inconceivable.🔽The practice of knowledge is inconceivable.

analyzed: acintyaḥ jñāna skandhaḥ
translated: The aggregate of knowledge is inconceivable.

original: acintyo me bhadanta bhagavansarvadharmeṣu jñānaviṣayaḥ pravartate /
analyzed: acintyaḥ me bhadanta bhagavan sarva dharmeṣu jñāna viṣayaḥ pravartate
translated: Venerable Blessed One, my sphere of knowledge in all phenomena proceeds inconceivably.

original: yathā ca me bhadanta bhagavansarvadharmāḥ samamyagjñātāḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca me bhadanta bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ sa mamyak jñātāḥ
translated: And as all phenomena are correctly known by me, venerable Blessed One,

analyzed: samyak parīkṣitāḥ samyak parijñātāḥ samyak vyavalokitāḥ samyak avabuddhāḥ
translated: They are well examined, well known, well seen, well understood.

original: tena hetunā mama bhadanta bhagavansaṃjñeyasya mahāyakṣasenāpateḥ saṃjñeya iti nāmadheyaṃ samudapādi //
analyzed: tena hetunā mama bhadanta bhagavan saṃjñeyasya mahā yakṣa senāpateḥ saṃjñeyaḥ iti nāmadheyam samudapādi
translated: For that reason, Blessed One, the name Saṃjñeya arose for me, the great yakṣa general.

analyzed: aham bhadanta bhagavan dharma bhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ vākya vibhūṣaṇa arthāya pratibhānam upasaṃhariṣyāmi
translated: Blessed One, I will provide eloquence for the sake of ornamenting the speech of the Dharma preacher monk.

analyzed: roma antareṣu ca tasya ojaḥ prakṣepsyāmi
translated: And I will infuse vigor into his pores.

original: mahāntaṃ ca tasya sthāma ca balaṃ vīryaṃ ca kāye saṃjanayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: mahāntam ca tasya sthāma ca balam vīryam ca kāye saṃjanayiṣyāmi
translated: And I will generate great strength, power, and energy in his body.

analyzed: acintyam tasya jñāna avabhāsam kariṣyāmi
translated: I will create an inconceivable illumination of knowledge for him.

analyzed: smṛtim ca tasya bodhayiṣyāmi
translated: I will awaken his mindfulness.

analyzed: mahantam ca tasya utsaham dāsyāmi
translated: And I will give him great enthusiasm.

original: yathā ca sa dharmabhāṇako na klāntakāyo bhavet /🔽sukhendriyakāyo bhavet /
analyzed: yathā ca sa dharma bhāṇakaḥ na klānta kāyaḥ bhavet  sukha indriya kāyaḥ bhavet
translated: So that the Dharma preacher will not have an exhausted body.🔽He will have a body with a sense of well-being.

analyzed: praharṣa jātaḥ ca bhavet
translated: And he will be filled with joy.

original: yenāyaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaḥ sūtrendrarājasteṣāṃ buddhasahasrāvaruptakuśalamūlānāṃ sattvānāmarthāya ciraṃ jambudvīpe pracaret /
analyzed: yena ayam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sūtra indra rājaḥ teṣām buddha sahasra avarupta kuśala mūlānām sattvānām arthāya ciram jambudvīpe pracaret
translated: So that this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, may circulate for a long time in Jambudvīpa for the sake of those beings who have planted the roots of virtue with a thousand Buddhas,

analyzed: na kṣipram antardhāpayet
translated: and may not quickly disappear.

analyzed: sattvāḥ ca imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rājam śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: And may beings listen to this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa,

analyzed: acintyam ca jñāna skandham pratilabheyuḥ
translated: and attain inconceivable wisdom.

analyzed: prajñāvantaḥ ca bhaveyuḥ
translated: May they be wise.

analyzed: aparimitam ca puṇya skandham parigṛhṇīyuḥ
translated: May they acquire immeasurable merit.

analyzed: anāgata idhvani aneka kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi acintyāni divya mānuṣyakāni sukhāni anubhaveyuḥ
translated: In the future, for many quintillions of eons, may they experience inconceivable divine and human happiness.

analyzed: tathāgata samavadhāna gatāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ anāgata idhvani anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeran
translated: May they be in the presence of the Tathāgata, and in the future may they fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sarvanarakatiryagyoniyamalokaduḥkhāni cātyantena samucchinnāni bhaveyuriti //🔽iti śrīsuvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarāje saṃjñeyamahāyakṣasenāpati
analyzed: sarva naraka tiryagyoni yama loka duḥkhāni ca atyantena samucchinnāni bhaveyuḥ iti  iti śrī suvarṇaprabhāsa uttamasūtra indrarāje saṃjñeya mahā yakṣa senāpati
translated: May all the sufferings of the hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama be completely eradicated.

analyzed: parivartaḥ nāma dvādaśaḥ
translated: Thus in the excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, the chapter on the great yakṣa general Saṃjñeya is called the twelfth.
The chapter on the treaty of the king of gods.

analyzed: namaḥ tasya bhagavataḥ ratna kusuma guṇa sāgara vaiḍūrya kanaka giri suvarṇa kāñcana prabhāsa śriyaḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Jewel Flower Virtue Ocean Beryl Gold Mountain Golden Radiance Glory.

analyzed: namasyasya aneka guṇa koṭī niyuta śata sahasra samalaṃkṛta śarīrasya śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya yasya iyam dharma ulkā jvalati
translated: Homage to that Śākyamuni Tathāgata, whose body is adorned with many trillions of virtues, in whose presence this torch of the Dharma blazes.

analyzed: namaḥ tasyāḥ aparimita puṇya dhānya māṅgalya sampannāyāḥ śriyaḥ mahādevyāḥ
translated: Homage to that Śrī Mahādevī, endowed with immeasurable merit, prosperity, and auspiciousness.

analyzed: namaḥ tasyāḥ aparimita guṇa prajñā samuditāyāḥ sarasvatyāḥ devyāḥ
translated: Homage to that Sarasvatī Devī, who is endowed with immeasurable wisdom and virtues.

original: tena khalu punaḥ kālena tena samayena rājā baladaketuḥ putrasya ruciraketoracirābhiṣiktasya ca rājyapratiṣṭhitasyaitadavocat /
analyzed: tena khalu punar kālena tena samayena rājā baladaketuḥ putrasya ruciraketoḥ acira abhiṣiktasya ca rājya pratiṣṭhitasya etat avocat
translated: At that time, on that occasion, King Baladatta said this to his son Ruciraketu, who had recently been consecrated and established in the kingdom:

analyzed: asti putra devendrasamayam nāma rājaśāstram
translated: Son, there is a royal treatise called the Treaty of the King of Gods,

original: yanmayā pūrvamacirābhiṣiktena ca rājyapratiṣṭhitena pitū rājño balendraketoḥ sakāśādudgṛhītam /
analyzed: yat mayā pūrvam acira abhiṣiktena ca rājya pratiṣṭhitena pituḥ rājñaḥ bala indraketoḥ sakāśāt udgṛhītam
translated: which I previously received from my father King Balendraketu, when I had recently been consecrated and established in the kingdom.

original: tena mayā devendrasamayena rājaśāstreṇa viṃśativarṣasahasrāṇi rājatvaṃ kāritaṃ babhūva /
analyzed: tena mayā deva indra samayena rāja śāstreṇa viṃśati varṣa sahasrāṇi rāja tvam kāritam babhūva
translated: By that royal treatise of Devendra's discipline, I ruled as king for twenty thousand years.

analyzed: na abhijānāmi aham antaśas eka citta kṣaṇa pramāṇa mātreṇa api kasyacid adharma sthita pūrvam
translated: I do not recall having ever acted unrighteously, even for the duration of a single moment of thought.

analyzed: katamat tatra devendrasamayam nāma rāja śāstram
translated: What is that royal treatise called Devendra's discipline?

original: atha khalu kuladevate rājā baladaketustena kālena tena samayena putrasya rājño ruciraketorimābhirgāthābhirdevendrasamayaṃ nāma rājaśāstraṃ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayati sma //
analyzed: atha khalu kula devate rājā baladaketuḥ tena kālena tena samayena putrasya rājñaḥ ruciraketoḥ imābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ devendrasamayam nāma rāja śāstram vistareṇa saṃprakāśayati sma
translated: Then, O Queen of the Gods, at that time, King Baladaketa extensively taught to his son, King Ruciraketu, the royal treatise called Devendra's discipline, with these verses:

analyzed: rāja śāstram pravakṣyāmi sarva sattva hitam karam
translated: I shall proclaim the royal treatise, which benefits all beings,

analyzed: sarva saṃśaya chettāram sarva duṣkṛta nāśanam
translated: Resolving all doubts, destroying all evil deeds.

analyzed: hṛṣṭa cittāḥ bhavitvā iha sarve nṛpatayaḥ pṛthak
translated: Here, all the kings, with joyful hearts,

analyzed: sarva deva indra samayam śṛṇudhvam prāñjali kṛtāḥ
translated: Listen with palms joined, to Devendra's discipline.

analyzed: vajra prākāra giri indre asmin deva indrāṇām
translated: In this vajra-encircled mountain, in the assembly of the lords of the gods,🔽The arisen world guardians asked Indra of the Brahmas:🔽What is the cause of the arising of the world?🔽What is the cause of its destruction?

analyzed: utthitaiḥ lokapālebhiḥ brahma indraḥ paripṛcchitaḥ
translated: What is the cause of the world's duration?🔽What is the cause of the world's peace?

analyzed: tvam naḥ sura guruḥ brahmā devatānām tvam īśvaraḥ
translated: You are the preceptor of the gods, Brahma, and the lord of the deities.

original: chettā tvaṃ saṃśayānāṃ ca cchindayāsmākaṃ saṃśayam // //
analyzed: chettā tvam saṃśayānām ca chindaya asmākam saṃśayam
translated: You are the cutter of doubts. Cut off our doubts.

original: kathaṃ manuṣyasaṃbhūto rājā devaḥ sa procyate /
analyzed: katham manuṣya saṃbhūtaḥ rājā devaḥ sa procyate
translated: How is it that one born as a human is called a god and a king?

original: yadiha mānuṣe loke jāyate ca bhavannṛpaḥ // //
analyzed: yat iha mānuṣe loke jāyate ca bhavat nṛpaḥ
translated: If he is born as a king in this human world,

original: kathaṃ devamanuṣyeṣu rājatvaṃ ca kariṣyate /🔽evaṃ hi lokapālibhirbrahmemdraḥ paripṛcchataḥ // //
analyzed: katham deva manuṣyeṣu rāja tvam ca kariṣyate  evam hi lokapālibhiḥ brahmā imdraḥ paripṛcchataḥ
translated: how will he rule over gods and humans?🔽Thus, the Lokapalas asked Brahma, the lord of the gods,

analyzed: sarvā sura guruḥ brahmā lokapālān iha abravīt
translated: and Brahma, the preceptor of the gods, spoke to the Lokapalas:

analyzed: yat iha lokapālebhiḥ etarhi mama pṛcchitaḥ
translated: If you Lokapalas have asked me this now,

analyzed: sarva sattva hita arthāya vakṣye iham śāstram uttamam
translated: for the welfare of all beings, I will speak this excellent treatise.

analyzed: nārāṇām saṃbhavam vakṣye yuktvā aham manuja ālaye
translated: I will explain the origin of kings, how they are born in the human world,

original: hetunā yena rājāno bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca // //
analyzed: hetunā yena rājānaḥ bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca
translated: and the reason why kings exist in the realms.

analyzed: deva indrāṇām adhiṣṭhāne mātuḥ kukṣau pravekṣyati
translated: He will enter the womb of his mother in the abode of the lords of gods.

analyzed: pūrvam adhiṣṭhitaḥ devaiḥ paścāt garbhe prapadyate
translated: First consecrated by the gods, he then enters the womb.

original: kiṃ cāpi mānuṣe loke jāyate śrīyate nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca api mānuṣe loke jāyate śrīyate nṛpaḥ
translated: Even though he is born in the human world, he is honored as a king.

original: api vai devasaṃbhūto devaputraḥ sa ucyate // //
analyzed: api vai deva saṃbhūtaḥ deva putraḥ saḥ ucyate  /
translated: He is said to be a son of the gods, born among the gods.

analyzed: trāyastriṃśaiḥ deva rāja indraiḥ bhāgaḥ dattaḥ nṛpasya hi
translated: A share was given to the king by the lords of the thirty-three gods.

analyzed: putraḥ tvam saha devānām nirmitaḥ manuja īśvaraḥ
translated: You are the son of the gods, appointed as the lord of men.

analyzed: adharma śamana arthāya duṣkṛtānām nivārakaḥ
translated: For the purpose of subduing unrighteousness, to restrain the wicked,

analyzed: su kṛtau sthāpayet sattvān preṣaṇa artham surālaye
translated: To establish beings in good deeds, and to send them to the abode of the gods.

original: manuṣyo vātha devo vā gandharvo vā narādhipaḥ /
analyzed: manuṣyaḥ vā atha devaḥ vā gandharvaḥ vā narādhipaḥ
translated: Whether a human, a god, a gandharva, or a king,

analyzed: rākṣasaḥ vā atha caṇḍālaḥ duṣkṛtānām nivārakaḥ
translated: A rakshasa or a chandala, you are the one to restrain the wicked.

original: mātā pitā vā nṛpatiḥ sukṛtau karmakāriṇām /
analyzed: mātā pitā vā nṛpatiḥ sukṛtau karma kāriṇām
translated: The mother, the father, the king, of those who perform good deeds,

original: vipākaphaladarśī tvaṃ devarājairadhiṣṭhitaḥ // //🔽sukṛtaduṣkṛtānāṃ ca karmaṇāṃ dṛṣṭadhārmikaḥ /
analyzed: vipāka phala darśī tvam devarājaiḥ adhiṣṭhitaḥ  sukṛta duṣkṛtānām ca karmaṇām dṛṣṭa dhārmikaḥ
translated: You are the one who sees the fruits of ripening, appointed by the lords of the gods.🔽You are the one who sees the fruits of ripening of good and bad deeds in this very life,

analyzed: vipāka phala darśī tvam devarājaiḥ adhiṣṭhitam
translated: Appointed by the lords of the gods.

original: yadā hyupekṣate rājā duṣkṛtaṃ viṣaye sthitam /
analyzed: yadā hi upekṣate rājā duṣkṛtam viṣaye sthitam
translated: When the king neglects the wicked deeds committed in his realm,

original: nānārūpaṃ na kurvīta daṇḍaṃ pāpajanasya ca /
analyzed: nānā rūpam na kurvīta daṇḍam pāpa janasya ca
translated: He should not inflict various forms of punishment on the sinful,

analyzed: duṣkṛtānām upekṣāyām adharmaḥ vardhate bhṛśam
translated: For by neglecting the wicked, unrighteousness greatly increases.

original: śāṭhyāni kalahāścaiva bhūyo rāṣṭre bhavanti ca /
analyzed: śāṭhyāni kalahāḥ ca eva bhūyas rāṣṭre bhavanti ca
translated: And deceit and quarrels again occur in the kingdom.

analyzed: prakupyanti ca deva indrāḥ trāya triṃśat bhavaneṣu ca
translated: And the lords of the gods become angry in the thirty-three abodes.

original: yadā hyupekṣate rājā duṣkṛtaṃ viṣaye sthiram /
analyzed: yadā hi upekṣate rājā duṣkṛtam viṣaye sthiram
translated: When the king overlooks a persistent evil in his realm,

analyzed: hanyate viṣayaḥ ghoraiḥ śaṭhyaiḥ api su dāruṇaiḥ
translated: The realm is destroyed by terrible and extremely cruel deceivers.

analyzed: vinaśyati ca tat rāṣṭram para cakrasya ca ākrame
translated: And that kingdom is destroyed by the onslaught of enemy armies,

original: bhogāni ca balānyeva dhanaṃ yasyāsti saṃcitam // //
analyzed: bhogāni ca balāni eva dhanam yasya asti saṃcitam
translated: And those who have wealth, enjoyments, forces, and accumulated riches,

original: vividhāni ca śāṭhyāni haranti ca parasparam /
analyzed: vividhāni ca śāṭhyāni haranti ca parasparam
translated: And various deceits, steal from each other.

analyzed: yena kāryeṇa rāja tvam na etat kāryam kariṣyati
translated: For the sake of which kingship is undertaken, he will not do that deed.

original: vilopayati svaṃ rāṣṭraṃ gajendra iva padminīm // //
analyzed: vilopayati svam rāṣṭram gaja indraḥ iva padminīm
translated: He destroys his own kingdom like an elephant a lotus pond.

analyzed: viṣamāḥ vāyavaḥ vānti viṣamāḥ jala vṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Unfavorable winds blow, unfavorable rains fall,

analyzed: viṣamāḥ graha nakṣatrāḥ candra sūryau tathā eva ca
translated: And the planets and stars, the moon and sun, are also unfavorable.

original: sasyaṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ bījaṃ va samyakparipacyate /
analyzed: sasyam puṣpam phalam bījam samyak paripacyate
translated: Crops, flowers, fruits, and seeds do not ripen properly.

original: durbhikṣaṃ bhavate tatra yatra rājā hyupekṣakaḥ /
analyzed: durbhikṣam bhavate tatra yatra rājā hi upekṣakaḥ
translated: Famine occurs there where the king is indifferent.

analyzed: an ātta mānasaḥ devāḥ bhavanti bhavaneṣu ca
translated: The gods become displeased in their abodes.

analyzed: yadā hi upekṣate rājā duṣkṛtam vicaret param
translated: When the king overlooks the evil deeds of others,

original: te sarve devarājāśca vakṣyanti ca parasparam // //
analyzed: te sarve devarājāḥ ca vakṣyanti ca parasparam
translated: all those kings of the gods will speak to each other, saying:

original: adhārmiko hyayaṃ rājā hyadharmapakṣamāśritaḥ /🔽na cireṇa hyayaṃ rājā devatāṃ kopayiṣyati // //
analyzed: adhārmikaḥ hi ayam rājā hi adharma pakṣam āśritaḥ  na cireṇa hi ayam rājā devatām kopayiṣyati  /
translated: This king is unrighteous, resorting to the side of unrighteousness.🔽Before long, this king will anger the gods.

original: devatānāṃ parikopādviṣayo'sya vinakṣyati /🔽śasrāṇi ca adharmaśca viṣaye'tra bhaviṣyanti // //
analyzed: devatānām parikopāt viṣayaḥ usya vinakṣyati  śasrāṇi ca adharmaḥ ca bhaviṣyanti  /
translated: Due to the anger of the gods, his kingdom will be destroyed.🔽Weapons and unrighteousness will occur in his realm.

original: śāṭhyānāṃ kalahānāṃ ca rogāṇāṃ ca samudbhavaḥ /
analyzed: śāṭhyānām kalahānām ca rogāṇām ca samudbhavaḥ
translated: Dishonesty, quarrels, and diseases will arise.

original: prakupyati ca devendra upekṣyanti ca devatāḥ // //
analyzed: prakupyati ca deva indraḥ upekṣyanti ca devatāḥ
translated: The king of the gods becomes angry and the gods overlook [the king's actions].

original: pralupyate ca yadrāṣṭraṃ sa nṛpaḥ śokamṛcchati /🔽iṣṭaviyogaṃ prāpnoti bhrātrā vātha sutena vā // //
analyzed: pralupyate ca yat rāṣṭram sa nṛpaḥ śokam ṛcchati  iṣṭa viyogam prāpnoti bhrātrā vā atha sutena vā
translated: When a kingdom is plundered, that king meets with sorrow.🔽He experiences separation from his beloved, either a brother or a son.

analyzed: priya bhāryā viyogaḥ vā prāpyate duhitā atha vā
translated: Or he experiences separation from his beloved wife, or his daughter.

analyzed: ulkā pātāḥ bhaviṣyanti pratisūryāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Meteors will fall, and there will be eclipses of the sun and moon.

analyzed: para cakra bhayam vā api durbhikṣam vardhati bhṛśam
translated: There will be the danger of invasion by a foreign power, and famine will greatly increase.

analyzed: priya amātyaḥ ca mriyate priyaḥ tu garjate vacaḥ
translated: A beloved minister dies, and an unloved one speaks with authority.

analyzed: suta abhīṣṭam priya āśvāsam bālā bhāryā virodhinaḥ
translated: The beloved wife of the young man, who was comforted by his beloved, was not opposed to him.

analyzed: parasparam hariṣyanti kula bhogam dhanāni ca
translated: They will take away the desired wealth of the sons, the comfort of the wives, and the wealth and enjoyments of the families, opposing the young wives.

original: deśe deśe haniṣyanti śastreṇa ca parasparam /🔽vivādāḥ kalahāḥ śāṭhyā bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca // //
analyzed: deśe deśe haniṣyanti śastreṇa ca parasparam  vivādāḥ kalahāḥ śāṭhyāḥ bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca
translated: Here and there, they will kill each other with weapons.🔽Disputes, quarrels, and deceit will arise regarding possessions.

analyzed: grahaḥ praviśate rāṣṭre vyādhiḥ bhavati dāruṇaḥ
translated: An eclipse will enter the country, and a terrible disease will occur.

analyzed: adhārmikāḥ bhaviṣyanti dikṣaṇīyāḥ tad antaram
translated: At that time, the unrighteous will become worthy of being punished.

analyzed: amātyāḥ pariṣadyāḥ ca bhavanti asya api adhārmikāḥ
translated: Even his ministers and assembly will become unrighteous.

analyzed: adhārmika jane pūjāḥ bhaviṣyanti tad antaram
translated: At that time, there will be worship of the unrighteous people.

original: dhārmikānāṃ ca sattvānāṃ nigraho bhavati dhruvam /
analyzed: dhārmikānām ca sattvānām nigrahaḥ bhavati dhruvam
translated: And certainly, there will be suppression of righteous beings.

analyzed: adhārmika jane mānam dhārmikānām ca nigraham
translated: Respect for the unrighteous people and suppression of the righteous,

analyzed: trayaḥ tatra prakupyante nakṣatra jala vāyavaḥ
translated: these three will become enraged there - the stars, water, and wind.

original: trayo bhāvā vinaśyanti adhārmikajano grahe /🔽saddharmarasanojaśca sattvojaḥ pṛthivīrasaḥ // //
analyzed: trayaḥ bhāvāḥ vinaśyanti adhārmika janaḥ grahe
translated: The three states will be destroyed - the unrighteous people in the eclipse,🔽the taste of true Dharma, the vigor of beings, and the essence of the earth.

analyzed: asatya jana saṃmānam satya jana vimāna tā
translated: Honoring the untruthful people and despising the truthful people,

analyzed: trayaḥ tatra bhaviṣyanti durbhikṣam atha nirbharam
translated: these three will occur there - famine, destruction, and fear.

analyzed: phala sasya rasa ojaḥ ca na bhavati tad antare
translated: And the essence of fruit, crops, and juices will not be there in between.

original: glānena bahulāḥ sattvā bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca /🔽madhurāṇi mahānti ca phalāni viṣaye'pi hi /
analyzed: glānena bahulāḥ sattvāḥ bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca  madhurāṇi mahānti ca phalāni viṣaye pi hi
translated: Many beings will be afflicted with diseases and attached to objects.🔽Even in the realm, the fruits will be sweet, large, and abundant.

original: parītā ca bhaviṣyanti tiktaḥ kaṭuka eva ca // //
analyzed: ca bhaviṣyanti tiktaḥ kaṭukaḥ eva ca
translated: But they will be limited, bitter, and pungent.

analyzed: pūrvāḥ ramyāṇi bhāvāni krīḍā hāsya ratīni ca
translated: The delightful things of the past, the play, laughter, and delights,

analyzed: sabhāḥ ramyāḥ bhaviṣyanti āyāsa śata vyākulāḥ
translated: The delightful assemblies will become filled with hundreds of hardships.

original: dhānyānāṃ ca phalānāṃ ca snigghabhāvo rasaḥ kṣayet /
analyzed: dhānyānām ca phalānām ca sniggha bhāvaḥ rasaḥ
translated: The essence and taste of grains and fruits will diminish.

analyzed: na tathā prīṇayiṣyanti śarīra indriya dhātavaḥ
translated: They will not nourish the body, senses, and elements as before.

analyzed: durvarṇāḥ sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti su alpa sthāmāḥ su durbalāḥ
translated: Beings will become ugly, with little strength and very weak.

original: bahu ca bhojanaṃ bhuktvā tṛptiṃ nāsādayanti te // //
analyzed: bahu ca bhojanam bhuktvā tṛptim na āsādayanti te
translated: Having eaten much food, they will not attain satisfaction.

original: balaṃ ca sthāma vīryaṃ ca na labhanti tadantare /🔽hīnavīryāṇi sattvāni bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca // //
analyzed: balam ca sthāma vīryam ca na labhanti tad antare  hīna vīryāṇi sattvāni bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca
translated: Strength, stamina, and energy will not be obtained in between.🔽Beings will become weak and attached to objects.

analyzed: sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti roga ārtāḥ nānā vyādhi prapīḍitāḥ
translated: Beings will be afflicted with diseases, tormented by various illnesses.

analyzed: grahāḥ bhaviṣyanti nakṣatrāḥ nānā rākṣasa saṃbhavāḥ
translated: There will be planets and stars, born from various demons.

analyzed: adhārmikaḥ bhavet rājā adharma pakṣa saṃsthitaḥ
translated: The king becomes unrighteous when he sides with unrighteousness.

analyzed: traidhātuke viruddhaḥ asti sarva trailokya maṇḍalam
translated: He is opposed in the three worlds, in all the regions of the three worlds.

original: aneke īdṛśā doṣā bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca // //
analyzed: aneke īdṛśāḥ doṣāḥ bhavanti viṣayeṣu ca
translated: There are many such faults in the objects of sense.

analyzed: yadā pakṣa sthitaḥ rājā duṣkṛtam samupekṣate
translated: When the king sides with evil and neglects to punish it,

analyzed: yena kāryeṇa rājā vai deva indrebhiḥ adhiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: The king who is established by the lords of the gods for a purpose,

analyzed: na tat karoti rāja tvam duṣkṛtam samupekṣataḥ
translated: If he does not perform his duty as king and neglects to punish evil,

analyzed: sukṛtena upapadyante sarva deva surālaye
translated: By good deeds they are reborn in the abode of all gods and suras.

analyzed: duṣkṛtena ca gacchanti preta tiryak narakeṣu ca
translated: By evil deeds they go to the realms of ghosts, animals, and hell.

analyzed: trāyastriṃśat devasthāne pratāpayanti duṣkṛtāt
translated: In the abode of the thirty-three gods, they are tormented by evil deeds.

original: yadā hyupakṣate rājā duṣkṛtaṃ viṣaye sthitam /
analyzed: yadā hi upakṣate rājā duṣkṛtam viṣaye sthitam
translated: When the king sides with evil that exists in his realm,

analyzed: pitṝṇām devarājānām bhavena sa aparādhikaḥ
translated: He becomes guilty before his ancestors, the kings of the gods.

original: na tadbhavati putratvaṃ na rajatvaṃ kṛtaṃ bhavet // //

analyzed: nāmarakṣā parivartaḥ pañcadaśamaḥ

analyzed: daśa devaputra sahasra vyākaraṇa parivartaḥ
translated: The chapter on the predictions to the ten thousand deva sons.

analyzed: evam ukte bodhisattvasamuccayā kula devatā bhagavantam etat avocat
